Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, fabulous service !!”
Reviews.Author: MonishaKrishna
Reviews.Content: My family group of ten (6 adults & 4 children) was on a two week vacation to Spain and Madrid was our last stop. Throughout our vacation, we stayed in excellent hotels and enjoyed the warm Spanish hospitality. Our last stop at the Grand Melia Fenix was like the icing on the cake and we ended our visit to Spain with a bang ! Though our first impression of the hotel was that it was a little run down, the hospitality and service was absolutely wonderful and more than made up for the looks of the lobby n front desk. My family was celebrating two major events with this holiday and though I had written to all the hotels we stayed at, the Grand Melia Fenix was the only one which greeted us with a lovely bottle of Cava wine, a platter of chocolate dipped strawberries and a large tray of candies for the children. The gesture was very touching. The hotel also accommodated our request for a late checkout (as our flight wasn't until late in the night) at no extra cost. Further, breakfast was very sumptuous, our rooms were well appointed, the toiletries in the bathrooms were of an excellent quality and room service responded to every request within minutes. All the staff were extremely courteous and helpful - especially the doormen who got us taxis very promptly. We were also happy with the location of the hotel - walking distance from Retiro Park and short taxi rides from most Madrid landmarks. The Hard Rock Cafe and Hop On Hop Off Tour stop right next to the hotel made life very comfortable as well. All in all, we had a wonderful stay and would love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Five star in all respects!”
Reviews.Author: Caesar63
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute pleasure staying at the Gran Melia Fenix in Madrid. My wife and I chose it as it is centrally located, seemed luxurious but good value and already had some great reviews. We were pleased to discover that it didn't disappoint in any aspect at all. It is indeed very well located. We took the Metro from the airport which cost just a few Euros, is easy to navigate and delivers you to the Plaza De Colon just two minutes walk from the hotel. The journey from the airport takes about 20 minutes. Once settled in, the hotel is perfect for exploring all areas of Madrid. Whether you want to visit the Prado, the Retiro Park, the Serrano shops, the Plaza Mayor, the Palace or the Cathedral, all are within a maximum of thirty minutes walk. Alternatively, if you want to explore further afield (or would rather not walk) two metro stations are just nearby. My wife and I were spending four days over the August bank holiday in Madrid (which also coincided with our wedding anniversary). I had mentioned our anniversary when booking online and was pleasantly surprised when we were congratulated immediately upon arriving at the check-in desk. When we reached our delightful, luxurious room we found chocolate-covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne on ice, with a personal note of congratulations! A very thoughtful touch. Check-in was very slick and friendly and our room exceeded all our expectations (we'd booked a premium room). The decor was impressively stylish, the room large, the bed beautifully sumptious and the furniture and fittings comfortable and high quality. It would be difficult to imagine a nicer room to stay in. The bathroom was equal to the bedroom with smart, modern fittings with black granite surfaces and Clarins products. We also had a fabulous view of the plaza which made us feel a part of the bustling city. When we finally turned in after walking for miles around Madrid, we were pleased to find that the curtains completely blacked out the lights from the square and the windows were 100% sound proof. Perfect for a great night's sleep (helped by the extremely comfortable bed!) Downstairs for breakfast the following morning continued this excellent experience. The public areas including the lounge and bar are fabulously furnished and decorated, feeling more like a comfortable palace than a hotel (indeed, having walked around the actual Palace in Madrid on the second day, the Gran Melia wins hands down!!) I don't usually enjoy hotel buffet breakfasts as they tend to comprise a bland selection of cereals, pastries and luke warm cooked breakfast. Again, the Gran Melia defied the norm. The food selection was not only vast but we also discovered that everything was high quality and extremely fresh. The fruit selection was excellent, the cereals, cold meats and pastries inviting and the yoghurt was hand made by the hotel. Delicious. We didn't have the hot food and so can't comment, but given the high standard of the rest of the buffet I suspect the hot food would have tasted equally good. This is the first time I have ever thoroughly enjoyed a buffet breakfast in any hotel I have stayed in throught the world - I actually looked forward to breakfast each morning - a first! To add to the cosy atmosphere, excellent decor and good value, the staff throughout the hotel were all very efficient and keen to help - superb service which the whole team should be proud of. If returning to Madrid in the future we would book again at the Gran Melia without reserve - there seems no reason to even consider other hotels. Thank you all for providing us with such a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DenCarAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 night in a small interior room but beautifully decorated and furnished. Good breakfast buffet, wonderful ornate dome and stairwell, so much character! Front desk staff very helpful and knowledgeable. Great location, walking distance to park, restaurants & shops. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “MOST OVERATED HOTEL IN MADRID”
Reviews.Author: ANNONYMOUS34225
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights and we had two rooms .This is not a 5 star hotel maybe it was 50 years ago.Our rooms were tiny.We had a big closet for a bedroom WITH DE-LUX DRAPES.Dome in the lobby is beautiful .This is not a good location..Overall is not worth the money.WE WILL NEVER STAY THE AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “A good reference”
Reviews.Author: NickieParis
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in the Gran Melia Fenix and despite the fact the fitness room was not available, I was quite content. All the staff is very helpful and smily. If you wish to relax the red floor is a must. At the red floor you can drink champagne served with canapés and all sorts of goodies! Last but not least, the quality of the bed and pillows with soft coton sheets is a treat. The breakfast is excellent with a very good fresh squeeze orange juice, give it a try! The hotel is kept clean which is vital. I certainly will choose the Gran Melia Fenix when I return to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality/Best Location”
Reviews.Author: jtbnyc
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Madrid and this hotel was perfection. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and the location was easy in every respect. As tourists we wanted comfort but not so "ultra" it would be over-the-top $$$$. This hotel wasn't. We loved the outside garden/bar and would end every day with a cocktail (beware the "signature" martini olives stuffed with anchovies!! Ugh). The rooms are beautifully appointed with every need. There is ice on the floor, which we found was not the norm in Spain. Enjoy this property, it is a grand hotel in the purest terms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Not Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: DCCool
Reviews.Content: We booked on Red level. Room included jacuzzi outside on patio and view of entire city. The water pipe from jacuzzi leaked causing small flood and we were moved to junior suite. Jacuzzi feature is a must if wish to soak up some sun while in water as few hotels in Madrid offered an outdoor pool. No room service fee and hotel food was quite good. The Red level room is stocked with every type of alcoholic drink imaginable and the lounge has light snacks, television, computer and printing services and a separate terrace overlooking the marvelous view of Madrid. The breakfast food was marginal. Hotel is not centrally located but taxis were always right outside and Hard Rock Cafe was right down the street. Overall, this hotel was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelja
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel in a fancy neighborhood! Restaurant for breakfast and the breakfast it self is really great! Everything is served till 11 o'clock which gave my husband and me a pleasure not to rush like crazy to eat a croissant! Staff is really nice and helpful, specially Mr. Jesus from reception desk. Lounge bar is cozy and serves great mojito cocktail! The only thing, for sure, I wouldn't recommend is a standard room, actually as per hotel web site this is a Deluxe category. It overlooks the inner court of the hotel which is really not a thrill... The room is small and dark...we called it our own "catacomb"! Definitely go for a higher category, it's worth it! The Spa was in renovation at the time we were there (beginning of May 2012.) so I can't say whether we missed something spectacular or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: franz m
Reviews.Content: I've been here with my family for a congress. It's a little far from Puerta del Sol (30 minutes on foot) as well as from Prado museum (30 minutes on foot). Our room was crowded by furniture, with a useless anteroom and a relatively small bathroom. Air-conditioning is controlled by a really awkward legacy system which should appear in The Design of Everyday Things book by Donald A. Norman as an example on how not to design domotics. Breakfast was gorgeous with fresh pressed juices at leisure (strawberry was my favorite)

Reviews.Title: “Better and Better”
Reviews.Author: mspain
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed Gran Melia Fenix before, but I stayed there again in July and this hotel gets better and better. Service is always excellent as is the location. Get a room with a jacuzzi and get Red Level. The Red Level is the best of any Gran Melia I have stayed at and greatly compensates for the room price as their free drinks and snacks are outstanding. I am upping them to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveltoeurope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the hotel.... excellent hotel with a good location. Staff were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff were always smiling, greeting you and could not do enough to make sure we were comfortable. My only criticism would be the service in the lounge/bar downstairs... it is expensive, and the service was almost non-existent - we had to find the server after sitting there for a while - then got our drinks and never saw the server again.... we also had to find someone to get us the bill so we could pay.... Aside from that, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like intruders”
Reviews.Author: BeatainOz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located close to a metro station and within walking distance to the three art museums. Unfortunately it’s a very small and very busy hotel and we felt like no one wanted us there. This is the first Leading Hotels of the World hotel where our membership was totally ignored. While we did get breakfast (because we asked for it), we didn’t get any upgrade (nor a sorry for not getting an upgrade) and there was no gift for us. We actually reminded the reception that we were LHW members, but only after explicitly asking for it, we got our free gift (a fruit salad, but no welcome letter). The room was extremely small for a couple. For a couple with a child, it seemed unsuitable as we couldn’t move. I do not recommend this hotel to people who need an extra bed. The bathroom was extremely small. We are thin people, but we had trouble moving around in the bathroom. One morning we went for breakfast without leaving the “Do not disturb” sign. When we returned to the room, the maid continued fixing the sheets, without taking any notice of us. We felt like intruders, as she wouldn’t stop. Since the room was too small for us to reach for things while she was there, we just left for the museums without taking the things we wanted. At a 5 star hotel, I would expect better trained staff, who would at least ask whether we needed to do something. This maid made us feel like it was her room, not ours.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Cigno2nero
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Fenix is the place to be when in Madrid. The are is central, nice and quiet and the whole experience, from check in to check out makes you feel special. Rooms are specious and bright and, although facing a crowded street, they are very quite. Breakfast is very nice with a wide range offered.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sophiscticated - great location”
Reviews.Author: Hammerschmidt
Reviews.Content: /this hotel on Place Colon is perfect - rooms are spacious and very well appointed and immaculate. The reception staff are very welcoming and porfessional with a smile. Great bar with amazing cocktails and an outside terrace!

Reviews.Title: “The best value/cost hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: germanmiami
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel in July 2012. Great looking hotel, customer service is the best, and the location is great in the middle of Madrid. The hop on/hop off buses stop in the same block as the hotel. It is also walking distance 3 blocks from the best high end shopping in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, it's Melia excellence”
Reviews.Author: Teragram10
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Gran Melia Fenix and again recommend the Melia chain of hotels and also the location of this hotel. The hotel is a wonderful, comfortable, good-feeling hotel in a perfect location to explore the vibrant, exciting and happening city of Madrid. The hotel is situated in the Plaza Colon which is a 15-20 minute walk to the Prado Museum, a must to visit in Madrid. Shopping, culture, restaurants and tapas bars are all within easy reach. For flamenco the Corral de Moreria is excellent and a show/dinner or show only option is available. Rooms are not huge but comfortable (bathrobes are the best I've had), sheets arechanged daily, towels large, white and fluffy and luxurious Clarins toiletries made my stay very pleasant. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the numerous staff I encountered during my stay were consistently genuine, pleasant and sincere. Thank you Melia for contributing to my very pleasant stay in Madrid. I reconmmend this hotel if staying in Madrid, you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Super luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: NavyDad03
Reviews.Content: The breakfast, rooms, service, and ambiance were so far above my expectations, I was stunned. This is how movie stars and government dignitaries live. In fact, some VIP was staying there during our stay... SWAT truck parked outside the service entrance 24/7, and numerous big young guys in black suits and ties with corded ear bus and large bulges under their coat wandering the public spaces at all hours. Very cloak and dagger feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Jane C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a long trip this year and it was lovely grand place with good staff and very good rooms. Ate there once in dining room which was bit empty but that's more the fact that I can't wait til 10.30 pm for dinner rather than the restaurant. They were renovating the gym whilst I was there so had to go down the road to the another place which was ok but hopefully they'll have it back to normal. There is a Red level which I had access to which is pretty good and has its own concierge and tapas area so if you don't need to eat lunch then this would suit you. There are rooms with jacuzzis on the terrace for your inner rock star and ones with view of Christopher Columbus which are pretty good. You'd be hard pressed to fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodation”
Reviews.Author: smokey17
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility, good location. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a place to pick!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbagags
Reviews.Content: First class all the way...Pretty much centrally located with 10-30 minute walks to many of the plaza's, museums, shops and restaurants. A little pricey at their bar and tapas area, but that's to be expected considering the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel but bring your own water!”
Reviews.Author: Tawabolarin
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel interior. Really stunning and the location was great However: For a five star hotel, they don't have complimentary bottle of water. To make things worse they sell a miserly 25cl bottle for 5 euros!! Completely unacceptable. This cheap extortionist tactic ruins the entire image of the hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding”
Reviews.Author: ALEX N
Reviews.Content: When I arrived my impression was not good. Old hotel, ancient looking lobby, small elevators, tiny rooms. Then I received the bad news: the gym was closed for renewal and I had to go outside the hotel to use another gym. After a while I started changing my opinion about this hotel. The bedroom was cozy and comfortable, pillows were very clean and everything worked almost to perfection. Room service was good both in food quality and staff efficiency. The breakfast buffet was very extensive with an excellent variety, and I could also order a la carte with no extra cost. The restaurant staff was friendly and very professional. The best service, however, was at the front desk, outstanding. I would not mind coming back to this hotel provided they reopen the gym.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms outside bar overpriced and the service is slow.”
Reviews.Author: adillster
Reviews.Content: lived up to the reviews on this site would recommend and stay again

Reviews.Title: “As usual lovely”
Reviews.Author: bishay
Reviews.Content: that was my second stay at mila fenix we got premier room with uprate to club or as they called it red level everyone very friendly from door guy till the level .on my birthday i asked the concierge office to book me table at hard rock cafe cause it was my birthday the problem was that weekend and national holiday but they did their best and got us a table when we got back at night at the lounge Senora Gemma knew it was my birthday i found in my room nice bottle of wine and Delicious cake . it is usually my choice in Madrid thanks for every one but still prefer the room in 6 floor more in five

Reviews.Title: “A great three nights on the red level”
Reviews.Author: NOS1234
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor we booked the red level at the Gran Melia Fenix and were very pleased with our stay there. The hotel room was really comfortable with lovely bed linen and duvet covers. The staff were really helpful and well informed about Madrid. The food etc in the red level area were great and it was good to have somewhere to relax. My only negative comment is that the hotel is located a little away from the main restaurants and bars in Madrid and we had to take a taxi at night - not particularly expensive so not a big problem. We had a meal in the restaurant, expensive and not particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “A true luxury hotel, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer007Dublin
Reviews.Content: Earlier in the year [ 2012 ] we had the opportunity to stay at the Gran Melia Fenix in Madrid, Spain and here are some of our impressions and memories collected. The Gran Melia Fenix is the flagship hotel of the Spanish Melia hotel chain and is a member of The Leading Hotels of the World. Location: Plaza de Colon on Calle Hermosilla 2 in the heart of the city, the same building houses on the opposite the Hard Rock Cafe Madrid. Access is easy to the attractions of the Spanish capital, the hotel is surrounded by famous art institutions, restaurants, cafes, the underground train and glorious shopping. First Impressions: A grand and beautiful building with a wonderful entrance, doorman was inside, saw us coming in the hotel, took our luggage and we could check-in, the lady from downstairs brought us upstairs to the RED LEVEL Lounge in which we could check-in and had a nespresso in the meantime while waiting a few minutes until our room was ready. Our room: Premium room with Jacuzzi and private terrace. A great room type, very elegant furnishings and great luxurious feel, ideal for our stay, this was something we looked forward too. From the fantastic bed with high quality linens, jacuzzi on the terrace, fully marbled bathroom, Clarins Paris bath amenities, large TV with international channels, fast internet access to a fully stocked mini bar, pillow menu and even a personal scent menu was on offer. RED LEVEL: Our room type included RED LEVEL lounge access. We loved this lounge during our stay as much as the whole hotel. The services offered are fantastic as is the lounge itself a masterpiece of hospitality. We encountered friendly staff, free newspapers, complimentary champagne, gorgeous happy hour with a real dinner offering and breakfast with a la carte items, all included in our overnight rate paid. Even when we think right now about the RED LEVEL we melt away in our positive memories. Eat || Drink: Beside the fantastic offerings in the RED LEVEL lounge, we enjoyed also room service incl. Spanish omlettes, fried rice specialities and hot chocolate. Overall, highly recommended. Overall: A wonderful heritage hotel in the heart of the Spanish capital, a true luxury hotel which had many famous names seen over the years. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel, Gran Melia Fenix is beautiful, elegant but not overbearing. This is what luxury is all about, special for the guest and special for the hotel, employees have shown pride to work there. We felt just that as guests too. Psssst.........As members of the MELIA MAS rewards program we received also a 40 Euro discount towards eating and drinking in the hotel, which reduced our final bill on check-out. Would we recommend this hotel? YES! Would we return to this hotel? YES!

Reviews.Title: “vacation in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Location is perfect for all needs. Got free room upgrade from deluxe to premium with view to plaza de Colon. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Fitzie28
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is an old historical hotel that is very luxurious. While the decor is not modern, the room was spacious and comfortable. The service from everyone we encountered was plesant, helpful and above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The highlight of the hotel was the bar DRY - a fun atmosphere with great cocktails and staff. Location was nice - clean and in the more upscale part of town (near great shopping!)...a little bit away from the main sights and nightlife. Not a budget hotel, but for service alone well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbOurne_pp81
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Staff were great. Room was amazing. Amenities were great. The only possibly negative thing if any at all is the location. It is still right in the city but a bit of walking is required to get to shops and restaurants (great if u like to walk) Would definitely love to go back again if we go back to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LUCIANAGS
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, in a great location, so it's possible to walk to many city attractions like Museo del Prado, Chuenca, Plaza Sant'Anna, Retiro etc. It's very close to Calle Serrano, where are located many famous stores, like El Corte Ingles, Prada, Lowe, etc. Turning the block there's a Le Pain Quotidien, where we took breakfast every day for a good price. The room is silent (they have double windows), quiet, comfortable, well decorated and very clean. I like it very much. The only thing I observed is that the common areas are needing a small renovation, specially the walls and doors need to be painted.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Luxury”
Reviews.Author: glennr2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Gran Melia Fenix and realized it was a luxurious hotel the minute we walked into the domed lobby. It only got better from their. Our room, while small, was comfortable and beautifully decorated. Both the bedroom and bathroom were separated from the entry by glass doors, unnecessary, but a nice touch. The glass door between the two parts of the bathroom was a bit impractical, considering the size and configuration of the bathroom and the placement of the door. (We learned from subsequent stays at three more Melia hotels that a redundancy of bathroom doors is a recurring theme.) We knew that we had arrived when we discovered that turndown service included not only a chocolate on our pillows but a towel and slippers on the floor on each side of the bed. The room was clean and the staff were friendly. Breakfast was extensive and everything was delicious. The location is good--about a 10-15 minute walk to the Prado--and public transportation is easily accessible. We would definitely return to this hotel the next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vkidman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of our travel agent. It is a quality hotel with very high-end furnishings. The rooms were very spacious for an older hotel in a European city. The location of the hotel was perfect -- near wonderful shopping and within a short walk to museums. The hotel's gym was under construction so we had access to a great gym in a near-by mall. We upgraded to the Red Level which was worth every penny (euro). The Red Level lounge provided daily breakfasts and an open bar with wonderful tapas/desserts and high-end liquor and wines from 1 p.m. to 10 p.m. I would definately recommend this hotel to other travelers. The only downside - which was typical of Spain - was very few people spoke English. However, they knew enough to help us find our way around.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing Queen needs a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clearly the hotel was originally constructed at great expense but is now showing fatigue. However - Any shortcomings are amply overcome by the helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Car0lfahan
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, great location, gorgeous food, well equipped rooms, very helpful staff..

Reviews.Title: “Red Level all the way...”
Reviews.Author: jehNJ
Reviews.Content: As with many hotels, its all about your expectations. We stayed at this hotel because of its old world charm and it surely delivered. The Red Level was great. It consists mainly of a small room on the 7th floor offering a private breakfast and snacks/open bar all day. I got the impression that the Red Level is a service add on, as supposed to a special room. For example, our room was on the 5th floor and a couple we were with were on the 6th floor, but we were both on the Red Level plan. Breakfast downstairs was good too. As for location, this hotel is about a 40 minute walk to Sol, which is the center of town. if you want to be where all the action is then this hotel is a little of out of the way. Its in the posh Salamanca district which is very upscale, great shopping and restaurants were only a block away. Retiro Park and all the museums were within easy walking distance. Taxis were easy to find and the subway was less than a block away. The Red Level concierage was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RafainLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid after a long transatlantic cruise at the Fenix. It was a great experiance. Nice, clean and spacious room and very good service. Also Well located

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with easy access to major attractions”
Reviews.Author: ProAndSuchi
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Colon metro station, Gran Melia offers a great location within a walkable distance from Prado Museum and Retiro park, and quick and easy access to Plaza Espanya, Plaza Santana, Plaza Mayor and other major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Patchesmum
Reviews.Content: Went with a friend to join a group who stayed in a different hotel for a hen weekend. Paid extra for room with whirlpool on balcony and for red level. Worth every penny. Excellent service, ate in hotel restaurant one night, lovely lovely food, especially the steak, and I am fussy! Very good value meal. Bar was great with very large cocktails. Would definitely go again, top drawer shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiTorrero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix at the end of April, beginning of May. I chose this hotel for our citytrip to Madrid for my wife and two of our children (17 and 20 years old) after reading all the positive reactions on tripadvisor. We stayed in two connecting rooms (see helpful room tips) The service was fantastic! Whether at the reception, in the bar, the excellent restaurant or anywhere else in the hotel, all the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The dinner in the hotel's restaurant (Epoque) was excellent, but if you fancy something completely different there is always the Hard Rock Cafe which is in the same building as the hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, the amenities provided were excellent and very complete. The hotel is situated outside the center of Madrid, but the metro and busses are close by. It is also situated close to the beautiful Ritero park and relatively close the Santiago Bernabéu stadion. The buffet breakfast has all you need from Spanish to English breakfast all in a very relaxed atmosphere. If you like luxury and excellent service this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great location - Red Level club excellent”
Reviews.Author: LONDONMANIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Melia Fenix for two nights at the end of Feb. the hotel was easy to spot across the road as we came out of the station. The metro is very simple to use from the airport. The hotel is beautiful and very grand. The spiral brass and marble staircase is a real feature, with thik carpet. Our room was immaculate and very comfortable with the "romantic package" champagne and fruit and candles waiting for us. The bed was massive. Floor boards creaked, but that just goes with the age and charm of the property. The decor was rather grown up and oppulent and included a large desk and plenty of wardrobe space. Very cosy. The red level package meant that breakfast was included and canapés were available throughout the day, as well as premium brand drinks, including champagne. The drinks selection was vast, wine perfectly chilled. Food was well presented and excellent quality. The only strange thing was that you weren't allowed to take drinks into your room. And at this premium you would expect at least bottled water to be in your room or at least allowed to be consumed away from the Red Level lounge. We asked for a bottle to take out with us and were given the tiniest bottle you ever saw. We just replenished at a local supermarket at 30 cents for 1.5L. Really silly to make us have to do that. Clarins toiletries were generous and replenished. We were asked to check out early even though our booking included a late checkout, but MY HUSBAND agreed and were allowed to continue using the facilities in return. I didn't mind really. There was a lovely terrace and comfortable seating area in th lounge. We ventured out mostly and didn't get to use our 80 Euro open credit and the hotel was a lovely place to come back to. The tourist buses operate from just outside. The property is located around a 15 - 20 minute walk to the main areas, which was a pleasant route. We had a great stay and I have no hesitation in recommending this period property. I will post my pictures in due course. There's a nice unassuming local restaurant across the road to your right as you leave the hotel which serves traditional tapas - very authentic and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: no1likeval
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were taking a cruise from Barcelona, but flew in to Madrid for a night, and stayed here...wow! The hotel from the outside looked kind of 'old' (fyi, this was our frist trip to Spain,or anywhere in Europe!) when we walked in, we saw that it was very classic and authentic. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, spoke great English, and were helpful in suggesting sights and areas to visit. Our room was beaufiul, like none I've seen in the states. You walk in to a small corridor with the bathroom to the left, and continue on to the bedroom, which has a french door ( i loved the separation). The detail and craftsmanship made it very romantic; gold details, lighting, drapes, wooden frames on the walls/doors, elegant furniture, comfortable bed/bedding...just great. The bathroom was a great size, very clean, and it had a bedet! Not used to those, but of course it was funny to see. No washcloths though, so take ur own, or use the small towels next to the bedet (i guess it's to dry off??). The location, I thought, was a little off the 'main touristy area', which I was unaware of at the time of booking. We were so tired from our long overnight flight, we did little sightseeing as it was, but found it pretty easy to walk to/from the hotel during the day and at night, as there were lots of people on the street for a Friday night. Comfortable, free internet in the room (with a cord), adapters available at the desk (for US hair tools,chargers etc.), friendly service, and overall beautiful. I'd recommend this hotel to those visiting Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathrynmwalsh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in March. It was booked as a birthday treat for my dads 50th. They provided a free upgrade, cake and cava. As soon as we arrived they wished my dad happy birthday! The hotel is very clean and upmarket. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The cocktail bar is fantastic (the garden outside is also lovely). the rooms are spacious and well decorated. There is a lovely turn down service each night and the rooms have all the extras you would expect from a 5* hotel. I will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply fantastic. The service was exceptional. I was there with my family for my birthday. The staff even presented me with a birthday cake and a bottle of bubbly in the room. The rooms were high quality only beaten by the high standard of very friendly service, The cocktails and the Martinis are a must - you will struggle to find better!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elena123_11
Reviews.Content: We went in April 2012 and stayed at 'red carpet level' which means that we had the right to use the Loundge located on the last floor. There we had all day refreshments and after 6PM some small bites which was even enough for dinner. Alcoohol served there was also on a high level (like Moet&Chandon champagne and 20 years old scotch).The good thing there is the great terrace where you could have a drink and also if you have kids they could play around while you are getting your drink watching the great vuew. The hotel is very well positionned,has a wifi in the room. On the gound floor there is a fameous restaurant in which we celebrated a birthday-the food was excellent,tres gourmet,with no many places so for sure you need to book in advance. The price was absolutely normal (just to compare- we payed more for lunch in the city center and the food was awful). If we go once again in Madrid this will be our choice for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Red Level”
Reviews.Author: rosba
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in this hotel using the "red level" . It is worth it as you can get free snacks during your stay which comes handy if you want a light lunch or grab a bite before dinner and the breakfast is in a separate area of the hotel. My only problem was that upon arrival on my second stay I've asked for a late check out (4 pm instead of 12 pm). I was told that it was not going to be a problem but that I have to ask for it the day of the check out. Guess what? The hotel is fully booked so no late check out. Red level is supossed to be flexible regarding late check outs. Not this time, folks. I have a plane to catch at 9 pm and have to leave the hotel at 12.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but more like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: donk93953
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for business and shopping in Madrid. The public rooms, nice. The bar "Dry" is wonderful....great staff. The rooms..tiny...We had booked a pemiere view room with breakfast. I was told upon check-in that they didnt have any available so I was being upgraded to their Red Level...basically a business center with a small buffet and bar. I was shown a room with a view of a building some 20 feet away. A bathroom that reminded me of the head on a boat it was so small. Two of us could not walk past each other in it. Didnt use the Red Level service ,but once. They didnt know how to mail a Fed Ex package, no need to go there again. Upon check out, I found I was being charged for Red Level service to the tune of 150 euros.!!!! The couldnt honor my reservation and they charged me for their inability to perform. In a word...avoid...their are much nicer hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris1612
Reviews.Content: Everything is here for a perfect stay. The rooms are wonderful and the staff service exceptional. Breakfast costs 28 Euros per person, but you can eat out locally at the very good cafes. Valet parking is also 28 Euros per night but makes life easier on arrival. Everybody is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificence in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Glindaba
Reviews.Content: This is an impeccably run hotel in a great up-market and quiet area yet still within reasonable walking distance to major sites in the city. Our Red level provided exclusive check-in area and some of the best lounge facilities we have experienced. A constant supply of freshly made tapas, sweets, Nespresso coffee and Moet made it hard to leave! However (at the risk of being heavily criticised) children should NOT be allowed in this area. After a minor problem (seamlessly dealt with) our room provided traditional luxury and was superbly relaxing. The bathroom was a LITTLE small, but we overlooked that due to the overall excellence of the hotel. Staff are courteous and friendly with a real willingness to assist. Breakfast buffet superb and the room quite beautifully run; nothing was too much trouble. Madrid is a real foodies paradise and remains elegantly grand yet bustling with life. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: Luxury47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here in February. The hotel is well situated and has a "Ritz" type feeling. Staff is friendly and cortuous. However, the restaurant recommended by the concierge turned out to be horrible. The breakfast buffett can be much better. While there is variety, the quality is not at par with other luxury hotels. For example, for cereal they serve Kelogg varieties in small boxes, the bread is plain old toast etc. The wifi in the room was the slowest I've ever encountered in a hotel. I will try another hotel next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but some defaults”
Reviews.Author: Olympicchampion
Reviews.Content: We booked directly at the Gran Mélia Fenix for four nights. We were adviced to stay on the Red Level and were not disappointed: fruit juices, drinks, snacks and even champagne were available for free from 7am to 23pm, a great experience ! The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. Everybody has a very good command of spoken English. Our room at the 6th floor was modern classy, the furnishings beautiful but unfortunately small and lacking of cupboard storage: a real pity! Room cleaning was outstanding and the ladies in charge of it very professional and pleasant. Also the bathroom was well equipped but tiny. Disappointing were the information we got at the Red Level wich was less good than at the "normal" reception desk. Also the spa/gym was under renovation and we were offered to go to the Reebook gym at 15 minutes walking distance from the hotel. We didn't fall in love with Madrid either although this city offers a lot.

Reviews.Title: “An excelent choise in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maximiliano J
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect five stars hotel. The location is central, a walk distance of the top majority atractives. The breakfast is excelent with 130 itens. Is the best breakfast I have had. I stayed for 5 nights and I didn't have any problem. My room had a street view, but didn't came any noise from street. the room has doubles windows. If you want to go to the gym, ask first, when I went it was closed to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Grand yet cozy”
Reviews.Author: Jimets
Reviews.Content: A very nice, historical hotel in the heart of the center of Madrid...the location is great to catch buses and metro or just walk about. The National Library is minutes away, also Plaza Cibeles with its great Postal Palace at its crown. Service is impeccable, the staff is going out of his way to be helpful; have asked to call another hotel and they offered to make arrangements. English is also spoken by all... a great help for those who are not multi-lingual. We had a conference there and the food was also exceptional - except the stake one lunch. Breakfast was my favorite, the buffet provides local fruits and delicacies, a really grand affair. Rooms are nice, well serviced daily, overall a 5 star experience. Perhaps the only thing lacking was a spa/gym, as theirs was under renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding - this hotel is flawless”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_V103
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is pricey, but this hotel is worth every penny. The rooms are modern classy, with STUNNING bathrooms and beautiful furnishings. Many of them have french doors, and no detail spared. The bar downstairs, going out onto the Colon plaza, is absolutely stunning. Fantastic menu of wines, champagnes and cocktails, with outstanding service and a lovely relaxed atmosphere. I haven't eaten here, but I imagine the food is equally eloquent and flawless. The staff are incredibly attentive, friendly and conscientious. WELL worth a visit - beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Red Level for four nights in March. Everything about our stay was 5 stars. Our room was comfortable with every amenity. The concierge service was wonderful and the lounge breakfast and snacks were excellent. I booked through hotels.com and received an excellent rate making this stay a truly tremendous value for a 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location: awesome. Service/Rooms: not so much.”
Reviews.Author: terencereis
Reviews.Content: Hm, so, yeah, I stayed there at the 1st week of January mostly due to location, some raving reviews and, yes, the stories about the Beatles and others. Location is perfect. Walking distance from everywhere you need to go in Madrid. Whether you're there for culture, food or shopping, it doesn't matter, you're nearby. Hence the 3 stars. Now as it comes to service: my wife and I arrived, nobody seemed to care about our luggage. We had to carry it ourselves. And those were no backpacks. And the staff remained oblivious about basic guests courtesy throughout our stay there (yes, on our way out we had to carry the luggage to the cab as well). Oh, the room. Possibly the worst located room on a hotel in history. And with a good chance of being the smallest as well. Only one window, with a view to the, well, I don't know what it was, but we needed to keep it closed, as it was some small concrete yard somewhere inside the hotel, right above our heads. Claustrophobic. Have I mentioned it was the same price as the other standard rooms - this was no promotion? Add to this an ice machine from hell at the corridor. Hotel lounge was completely unappealing as well. Basically it was a big let down. There are better places for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, oh.. and did I say location!”
Reviews.Author: Maloneman
Reviews.Content: I normally travel to Madrid several times a year.. I have found my hotel! The Melia Grand Fenix is great!!... I have stayed in several hotels in Madrid (all of which having been more expensive). The location is excellent, the staff courteous, and the rooms clean (and if you place the "do not disturb" sign on the door, it is respected. The only downside (but it doesn't bother me) is that the bathrooms are small (but well equipped). The Clarins shampoo & conditioner, and other products in the bathroom came in handy. There are several tv stations in English (which is nice).. Also, the tv is big and modern. This is my fifth time staying at this hotel.. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: WomanEyeMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. The service was excellent, room and bed was very comfortable. We loved the bar and had an amazing lunch at their restaurant, great food and wonderful service. I highly rate this hotel, only small downside is that it is a little far away to walk to the main attractions but it is only a 5 minute walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: Nick G
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is in another league from so many modern hotels. Polite, attentive and personal. The cocktail bar is also superb. The restaurant, though rather quiet, is also excellent. Rooms very nice although not huge. Brilliant location for the sights of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Reunion !! (Jan 2012)”
Reviews.Author: Cairo1988
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city! Excellent location with transport links readily available. Room smaller than anticipated (Room 518 - but had excellent view) and unable to store suitcases out of sight. TV channels were disappointing - perhaps a movie channel showing English films could be considered! Breakfast was excellent - enjoy!! Visits to Toledo (from Atocha) and Segovia (from Charmatin) via high speed trains are must as is the San Miguel Market near Plaza Mayor in Madrid itself. Enjoy Madrid it is a terrific city and can't wait to visit again - still so much to see!!

Reviews.Title: “Good times on Red Level”
Reviews.Author: Under_many_stars
Reviews.Content: Through hotels.com I booked one night on "Red Level" - in a pricerange close to the double of what I would normally like to pay. But it was worth the money. All of it. The hotel has made a special "Red Level" where guests are given speciel dedicated check-in (and a glass of champagne), but the really benefit here is the all included breakfast/afternoon/evening snack lounge. The word snack hides the fact that from 1 pm-11 pm you have free access to a well stocked bar, a wide selection of tapas, desserts, different types of coffee, etc. Very, very good indeed. I think I saved to 2 meals on that account plus breakfast - probably among the best breakfasts I have had at hotels. The is huge and have separate walk-in dressing room and just everything you could ask in 5-star hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JamesA045
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gran Melia Fenix for work in Feb 2012. The hotel is situated at Plaza de Colon in the heart of Madrid. The staff were extremely polite and I was upgraded to a room overlooking the avenue of Castellana. The room was huge with large double bed and separate hall leading to bathroom. Breakfast was excellent. I was recommend this hotel for the business or leisure traveller - worthy of its high TA rating.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. The room was very comfortable and quiet with the extra touches you would expect from such a quality hotel. Staff were friendly and professional, especially the breakfast room staff. The location is great, a very short walk to the subway station that brings you to anywhere in the city or to the airport quickly and reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, will return”
Reviews.Author: tinxxle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a present for a "big" birthday weekend at the beginning of December, first time in Madrid...and we couldn't have chosen better for location, service and style. The lady on reception was wonderful (wish I could remember her name!) She recommended some local restaurants for us and I have to say they were fabulous, within walking distance and not the usual tourist traps, a real taste of proper spanish cuisine. The rooms were fab, extremely quiet, lots of bits of bobs like shampoos etc., The cocktail bar in the hotel and the bar men were just lovely, and we were treated like VIPs by the bar manager.. especially when they found out it was my Birthday. The only thing we did find was that for such a large hotel we had to queue for breakfast in what was rather a small breakfast area.. one or two people even jumped the queue by just ignoring those that were waiting..and still managed to get directed to a table (a little bit more organisation is required here). But this was a tiny blip in what was an overall exceptional and memorable experience and yes I fell in love with Madrid and will return. The hotel is also located within walking distance of all the upmarket shops and boutiques. Thank you so much Gran Melia xx

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: Don9
Reviews.Content: Thyere was a fairly long delay when we arrived to checked in at reception (due to other guests mislaying their passports) but there were apologies from the staff and we were soon taken up to the red level floor and into our superb room. It had the wow factor and a great view of the city. The breakfast every morning was very good and the concierge was only too delighted to recommend sights for us to visit. If you pay extra for the red level service you have free use of the bar from 11am until 11pm where you will find all sorts of snacks, canapes and unlimited supply of Moet and Chandon! The hotel is certainly in a busy area of Madrid. There are 3 and 4 lane roads everywhere and the traffic is constant both day and night but you don't have to walk far before you can get away from the noise in one of the many parks nearby. I have to say also that the windows in the room were so good we couldn't actually hear any traffic noise at all. A few streets behind the hotel are some elegant old fashioned shops and some designer names - a pleasant are to walk in the evening. An excellent 5 star hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service , elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwillmousa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with out side jaccozi, it was luxury and the balcony was bigger than the room and it was fun staying there. We had lounge access it included a busniss centre and free of charge snakes and drinks .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lbaena
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the perfect spot of Madrid with an excellent staff willing to help and direct tourists all day long. The red carpet service located on the 6th and 7th floor is the best choice. Here are located the best rooms in the hotel. The Staff is very friendly, excellent food and very convenient for business or pleasure. This is a 5 stars hotel without a doubt. I hope I can come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Madrid and a home I love”
Reviews.Author: enriquedemarchena
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Fenix for the last 12 years almost every year. I didn't go last year. I found it better, much better. The service improves which is a lot to say. How do you improve something that was almost perfect? With attention to the minimum details. The bar has been remodeled. Many people say is the best bar in Madrid. The rest remain in the same place looking to satisfy its cadre of loyal customers.

Reviews.Title: “Best position in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Conniegreyvensteyn
Reviews.Content: Except for the room being small, this true five star hotel is in a wonderful position. The smartest area . Quiet street, walk to the best shops, restaurants and the terrific food market 100 meters up the road. Very efficient and helpful staff and a great big bar with interesting drinks and an outside area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bakfar
Reviews.Content: A marvelous hotel with a wonderful luxurious feeling, superbly furnished rooms, fabulous bathrooms and incredible service. We paid extra for breakfast but it was worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be treated wonderfully and in great surroundings in a terrific neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious City Hotel with Excellent Standards”
Reviews.Author: BON_VOYAGE245
Reviews.Content: Our visit here was for two nights over Valentines Weekend.. A while ago I know, but better late than never!! We stayed in deluxe penthouse suite.. This was an elegantly furnished room with separate lounge, a terrace with seating area, whirlpoool and also with that, the bonus of fantastic views.. The bed was extremely comfortable with luxurious bed linen.. The Clarins complimentary toiletries were an added treat.. as was the welcome of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberrys ( I presume a valentines special). The use of the Red Level Lounge is well worth the extra expense.. It serves breakfast for Red Level guests, then throughout the day continues to serve refreshments followed later by a good range of alcoholic choices accompanied by lite bites and a small tapas selection.. This was a nice way to start the evening before venturing out for dinner. I would recommend the restaurant downstairs if you want more choice for breakfast. The hotel has a classical elegant atmosphere, the staff are friendly and proffessional with impecable service.. The only negative is that it is a little too far from the Old Town which seems to have more choice of traditional spanish restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: NunoVaz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed only one night in this hotel, chosen mainly due to the excelent reviews on Trip Advisor. The Hotel is very well located, near the main cultural and shopping venues of Madrid. The Hotel Restaurant was very nice, and the Bar was excellent. Nevertheless the room (a Deluxe Room, not the most cheap room) was crampy and noisy, which resulted in a not so good night sleep. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recomend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The service devalues the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: cristianemendonca
Reviews.Content: Is unbelievable the service in Gran Melia Fenix!!! A hotel like that can't use the title 5 stars... The rooms are good (except the smalls bathrooms...) but the staff is really inefficient and impolite!!!! I don't recomend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl070
Reviews.Content: Wow - this really is a luxury hotel. Quiet spacious rooms, luxurious linen and top quality service. Some people might think the bathroom's are small but I can't say I spent much time in the bathroom so not a big concern for us. We used the conceirge service before we arrived to book one of the best michelin starred restaurants I have ever been to (and I have been to quite a few). We told the hotel we were there for my parents significant wedding anniversary and they received champagne in their room and presents. They also notified the restaurant about the celebration and we received VIP treatment! It's worth the extra price to use the red level executive type lounge. We had breakfast and lunch in there almost every day and it was good value - including the unlimited champagne. The hotel is a bit far away from the old town (about a 15 minute stroll) but not so that it was annoying. Highly recommended and when I re-visit Madrid I will be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to see in 2012.”
Reviews.Author: darren_entwistle
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 wonderful nights at the Gran Melia Fenix. Everything about this hotel is first class. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Shishito
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Location superb. Classy european feel. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reedcc
Reviews.Content: I stayed her last Monday night for one night before heading south to Seville. This was by far the best hotel of my week in spain. The room was nicely decorated and the bath room was very luxurious. The bed extremely comfortable which was very welcome after traveling for a day and a half. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We did not use the hotel restaurant as the breakfast was a little pricey, however there was a great spot around the corner that offered a delicious, inexpensive alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Just an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MarinaMariolaESP
Reviews.Content: Location,location and real 5 stars service.. Located in one of the best Madrid areas,great to walk around,shopping or dinning. Excellent welcome,check-in service,helpful staff,rooms,beds,pillow menu,minibar,facilities,breakfast,beautiful Martini bar. In our first day we had some demands for our 4 months old baby and the staff was highly helpful, even we asked for a baby cot and didnt charge us for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Gilda1967
Reviews.Content: What can i say not too sound too cheese about this place? Firstly the location is fantastic, easy access from the airport via the underground. The staff could not be more helpful in giving advice about places to eat and the room was way above our expectation. Immaculate room and although we had the view on the courtyard it was without a fault. The bar outside was wonderful providing anything you dream off but indeed expensive. But sometimes you have to pay the price not as much as for the drinks but for the ambiance. Without a shadow of hesitation i would recommend this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice option for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TeamSmallState
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. We were in Madrid for a sights and food trip. We upgraded to the Red Level. The room was great, sound proof with it's own small entry way. The room was pitch black and sound proof which came in handy following the Adventurous Appetites Tapas Tour (highly recommended for the more adventurous). The Red Level lounge was great for snacks and drink. A very well stocked bar. The concierge was very helpful and booked us for a fantastic Flamenco show. It seemed more local and less touristy and was a great show. I would stay here again. My one concern was the location when looking on the maps, however it is a relatively short and nice walk to most major sights. On the main strip but away from the crowds. P.S. Madrid is very underrated in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ECrowther
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. The hotel staff is professional, courteous and efficient. We stayed on the Red Level (concierge), which means concierge service, a private terrace, lounge with free drinks of all kinds and a variety of snacks, including meats and cheeses, a tall bottle of water and fresh fruit in the room, and other services we did not have the time to explore. The room was beautifully and tastefully decorated and offered every imaginable amenity and all the conveniences and comfort of a modern 5-star hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious, and our room included a small foyer, a separate area with a work desk and a walk-in closet. The Grand Melia Fenix is located on a major thoroughfare next to an upscale shopping district, just blocks from the historic heart of Madrid. If you like to walk, get a map from the concierge and stroll through the historic center, past the various plazas bustling with activity, to the Royal Palace and Cathedral. There are restaurants, tapas bars and pubs everywhere, so you can stop to eat or drink and rest your feet any time. That is the best way to see the city, and you can always take a taxi or the metro back to the hotel. For a superb meal, go to Alkalde, just 3 blocks away at Jorge Juan 10, serving lunch, tapas or dinner. This restaurant offers authentic and delicious Spanish cuisine and excellent service in a cozy environment. The concierge sent us there for dinner, and it was a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “gran melia fenix hotel madrid spain”
Reviews.Author: shelley b
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Gran Melia Fenix was delightful. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was stocked with all the amenities such as toothbrush and toothpaste etc...Breakfast was wonderful, everything was delicious and the service there was top notch. All the hotel staff was very helpful, kind and always available. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for weekend”
Reviews.Author: conagra
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location and staff are very helpful and friendly. The restaurant is good for hotel dining and breakfast service was excellent. Location for shopping excellent. Remember that you are next door to a Hard Rock Cafe for taxi directions!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: bishay
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel from from the 8th till the 13th in red level room with my mum . from the moment you step in the hotel you smell lovely aroma . check in was in minutes thew room was lovely the lounge was really very nice got outside patio for smoker like me . I would like to thank Gemma she was more than helpful everyone was extra kind the break fast at the main restaurant was lavash i asked for tortilla con patatas was wowwwww everything u can ask for you can find everyone is smiling even when i asked about not that important info they look for the details print it out and handed to me one day i asked for green tea the receptionist at red level brought them by herself sure if i would visit Madrid again would stay there cause it is very close to the nice shopping area and transpiration very easy thanks everyone there

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of Madrid for our customer event!”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: This past week I've hosted a VIP customer event and we reviewed 5 Madrid hotels and decided upon the Gran Melia Fenix and I am extremely glad we did. We had 6 employees and 14 customers join us for 3 nights and had nothing short of 5*, Thumbs-Up from all who came to our event. From the curb side friendly greeting, to our checkin on the VIP level lounge, every single staff member we came in contact was loverly, cheerful and helpful. We had a variety of Red-Level rooms, all of which had plenty of room, and amenities as well as access to the private lounge on level 7 so upgrading our rooms was well received by our visitors. Breakfasts were nice, plenty of choice and efficient with good seating in the AM's. We used the Dry Bar, and the general bar on 2 evenings and had great service, very comfortable seating and some wonderful cocktails. FYI, the Dry Bar is famous for their "Dry Martini's" which are really nice and will lead to you getting a certificate for drinking one (hiccup, or more). The location is pretty good for Madrid, but getting a large bus into the side street is a bit of a challenge so the 2 evenings we used one to go out, we found this harder to deal with, but it's not a black mark on the hotel we'd have to say. We also used the newly refurbished meeting rooms on -1 as well as the business centre and had good feedback from our VIP's on it. The meeting rooms are tastefully done, and our small concern about the polished stone floors being noisy were proven wrong when tables and chairs were in. Our instincts in selecting the hotel were well founded, and our VIP guests agreed we'd all like to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: jenesaispasqui
Reviews.Content: Good service, cosy hotel. Rooms a bit small, the view I had was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small rooms, questionable views”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler23366
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Fenix in Madrid offered exceptional service, a friendly staff, and a pleasant home during our vacation. My only criticism is that even after paying for a Premium room which faces outward instead of facing the courtyard the room we got simply faced another building and offered no view at all. The upgrade was a total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLM22
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The rooms were very nice, spacious and luxurious. Bathroom was a little on the small side, but not a problem. Location was good, but a little too far from some of the main things I wanted to do/see. However, if you don't mind walking it is fine. Must say the staff was very helpful! I left my glasses in the room. I contacted the hotel in hopes they found them and could mail them to me. They responded to my email quickly and were happy to arrange shipping (at my cost). Thank you Gran Melia Fenix for your assistance and excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “A superb place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Taronti
Reviews.Content: We spent a perfect 8 nights here in early November. This is a true 5 star experience in every way particularly if you purchase the red level. This gives you access to the seventh floor lounge. Here you can eat breakfast and a variety of hors d'oeuvres till 11pm. The lounge has a full bar, a red dressed concièrge at her desk waiting to help and, best of all, an iced magnum of good French champagne right at the entrance. The concièrge service is excellent, Gemma being particularly helpful. It is somehow nice never having to deal with the ground floor. The rooms are beautifully finished and clean. Ours had a nice view over the Plaza Colon and was very well soundproofed apart from some creaking from the floorboards above. Our room was promptly made up each day while we had breakfast. A plate of food and some liquid refreshment (water to cava) appeared in the room each afternoon. I was initally dismayed as the matress of our king bed felt hard but I slept like a baby. I cannot recommend this hotel too highly.

Reviews.Title: “A beuatyfull - no surprises hotel”
Reviews.Author: happy_kampy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed everything in a classical atmosphere. The location was great. Should take off this ugly sign on the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha T
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 4 night stay in Madrid with family of 5. Expensive but lovely rooms, well appointed, good size, nice decor and good bathroom. Position is excellent for Salamanca, great up market shopping district, cafes and restaurants. Not close to other attractions but tourist red bus stop is very close and easy to use and a good way to see Madrid. Staff were excellent, especially Eduardo at front desk, very helpful. Breakfast was excellent, food great and staff friendly. Lovely hotel, in quiet district with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, very helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: JuliaC509
Reviews.Content: Best hotel of our tour to Spain, Portugal and Morocco. Very helpful front desk and concierge. The restuarants they recommended were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but average in this price range”
Reviews.Author: markpjarvis
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel with good service and amenities but in this price bracket no more than is expected. The rooms are quite well appointed if a little small. The bathrooms are OK with some nice touches such as a grooming set with razor/shaving foam/toothbrush & paste. The location is convenient for the Salamanca area of Madrid with its designer shops. The Prado is about a mile to the south. The cocktail bar/terrace is pretty good and worth it for the people watching. Breakfast is quite extensive with almost everything you can think of on offer - but again nothing that "wows"!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia Fenix Madrid”
Reviews.Author: F_Costa_11
Reviews.Content: Just Ecellent. We satyed for fiv days at the Hotel. Great location, walking distance from all great restaurants. Very clean and confortable room, Excelent service at the front desk and the same for Concierge. We had a wonderfull time at the Madrid and for sure the Hotel helped a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SFore
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Madrid, I had no idea where to stay, but based on fellow TA members' reviews, I decided to take a gamble on GMF. After spending 4 nights there last week, I have to say I was very pleased with the service and stay we experienced. When I made my reservation on their site, I signed up for the Leading Hotels membership which got me a room upgrade and several other nice amenities during our stay including a nightly treat brought to our room! Everyone was very courteous and our room was left impeccable every day when we got home from a long day of exploring the city. My only gripe was that there was no Wi-Fi accessible on the first floor, you had to go down to the lobby. Our free daily breakfast (LHOTW Card Perk) was very nice and we enjoyed a great meal in their restaurant. The concierge helped us with all of our dinner reservations and any other need we had. I'd def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Benben2011
Reviews.Content: excellent service, very comfortable room and very rich breakfast. This is the second time we have been there and we got the same service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Plaza de Colón”
Reviews.Author: Londonsense
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times when in Madrid, mostly for one or two nights at the time. The check in procedure is consistently swift, and the front office staff are very courteous. If anything there seem to be too many people behind the desk, and roles are not really clear since the reception and concierge desks are one and the same. The issue with that is that you might end up waiting to check in while another customer is getting copious information about good restaurants in Madrid. In a couple of instances the key did not work, therefore I had to return to the front desk, which is annoying but not unheard of. The room size and layout are normally good, but when it comes to the position, it gets trickier. I have been in rooms that pracitcally face a wall on the first floor, and others that face the square on the sixth floor, all for the same price, therefore use your charme wisely upon check in. While the quality of the bed is average, the pillow quality is definitely below average. Most times I have been able to get a decent pillow after asking for it. The acoustic insulation is not great, and at times you can hear the next door neighbour watching TV or the traffic outside. The toiletries are really good, with complimentary shaving and dental kits. While free, wireless access is a bit of a pain, since you need to keep inputting the password every time your iPhone goes on stand by, and also need to get a new password every 24 hours. Breakfast in the morning is really nice but expensive if all you want is coffee and a croissant. The restaurant can only offer the buffet breakfast (one of the best I have seen), which comes with a €28 price tag. Why not introduce a more basic or continental version for people that do not want to splurge? Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jerchung
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia Fenix is right at Plaza De Colon, where there is a tourist information centre, a few metro stations from Sol, Gran Via, Prado, Santiago Bernabeu, etc. And also, with the high end shopping district of Salamanca right on its back. So, it's very convenient. The outlook of the hotel building is rather nonedescript. The indoor deco of Gran Melia Fenix is far from chic or stylish, a bit dated but very grand, e.g. the red carpeted stairs, the marbled lobby, the chandelier, etc. The room we got was on the Red Level. I assume only if one asks, the hotel would suggest an upgrade to the Red Level (not for free though). Such upgrade, at 80E per day in our case, was well worth the money. Private check-in, free buffet breakfast, snacks, free flow of soft drinks and even hard liquors and champagne all day plus free unlimited use of Wifi are all included in that price!! The room itself was reasonably sized. As other reviewers have commented, the bed was very comfortable. With double glazed windows, the room is practically insulated from any noise from outside despite its being on a rather busy main street. Sevice of the staff was superb!! On one occasion, I asked for a LAN cable but there was none at the Red Level lounge. I was asked to have some snacks and a drink first and the cable would be delivered to my room direct. I only stayed for a while but when I got back to my room, the cable was already there!! Also, while I was told that Hard Rock Cafe, which is situated on the G/F of the hotel, does not acept any reservation, the staff nevertheless made a call and did get me a reservation on a very busy Friday night!! Too many good things to say about this hotel, simply excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveler_011
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located right in Plaza De Colon so it's also very convenient. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The hotel itself is well maintained, and the staff have always been helpful. There are many restaurants nearby the hotel, and the Hard Rock Cafe is right next door as well. The bar is very nice for a late night drink and it's not quiet and not too loud. I've stayed in this hotel several times and its always consistently very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Hopefulglaswegian
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Salamanca district. Supreme room was of a reasonable size and well furnished/equipped. Too few hangers only complaint. Our room overlooked Plaza de Colon. It was very quiet thanks to secondary double glazing. Within 15 mins walking distance of Prado and further 10 mins to heart of the old town. Surrounding area is pretty up-market with many shops and reasonable restaurants. Plenty of taxis (about 6 euro to Plaza Mayor) and underground close by. Staff v friendly and helpful. Breakfast fine with lots of fresh fruit. Pastries were disappointing though. The Dry bar at the front of the hotel is a good place for a pre or post-dinner cocktail. Worth getting a Madrid Card if you want to avoid standing in queues for the Royal Palace and major museums. We got a one day travel pass with this for free which was useful, not sure if that was a one off deal or not.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDE411
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, beautiful decor, excellant service and welcome. Stayed 1 night while on a business trip, I will definatley return. It was an overall wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: rathin100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed with excellent amenities, comfortable bedding, first rate housekeeping friendly concierge.I had a room with a view the rooms are NOT large(I had a premium room) ok for me as solo but would br ceramped for 2, I think. Two major glitches (1) Poorly designed toilet the bathroom in my room was cramped, if well appointed. The toilet was jammed in such a way that it could not be straddled so sitting on the pot is an unpleasant experience (2) booking is a mess. First I booked on melia.com was promised a 40. euro voucher online this never came despite calls to the website the hotel guest relations also tried but nothing came of it. This is annoying. Don't like being lied to. This is, in fact, fraud but the amount is too little to botherAt checkout I was told someone from melia would get back to me --no one offered to give me an equivalent credit ---- but of course no one has. the hotel is very careful to emphasize that it is a separate entity from the booking service melia.com, and they probably are, but this is no use to customer. Melia seems to be a sleazy chain. Be careful. second the night before I checked out I asked for express checkout --because the reception is tiny and I'd noticed morning queues. No one knew what I was talking about...amazing! The next day I had to queue as a result. Sloppy. I stayed 5 nights and overall the stay itself was comfortable. Let down by sleazy brand and poor front office knowledge Oh and don't bother eating or drinking in the hotel. The bar is excellent and I used it, but found later Much better value all around the neighborhood, including breakfast just across the road at less than 10 euro

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: armando q
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful experience in every way. The hotel public areas are beautiful, comfortable, and inviting. Great restaurant; and terrace bar is a terrific place to relax and enjoy drinks. The buffet breakfast has great variety of offerings. Room was spacious, very comfortable, and well-equipped. Hotel service was superb. Special thanks to hotel staff who are professional and caring. This is no doubt a very well-managed luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked here after being told about the hotel by a work colleague, it was stylish and elegant. We were told we were upgraded but the room was fairly small to what we are used to, the room was well kept and clean, staff were friendly and helpful. The location was good and we could walk almost anywhere into SOL took about 25 minutes, Saturday and Sunday are quiet in Madrid so it easy to travel by bus. Great city to spend a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Una GRAN experiencia!”
Reviews.Author: Eframp
Reviews.Content: We returned two days ago from a week at the Gran Melia Fenix and it was wonderful! After having been in Madrid twice before, we were pretty familiar with the area and knew that the hotel was in a wonderful location. We booked a room on the Red Level and it was definitely worth the price...breakfast in the morning and delicious snacks and drinks until 11pm. The staff of the Red Level was very helpful and definitely made it their mission to make sure that we had the best trip possible. Not only did they help with activities and restaurants in Madrid, but they also were available to answer questions about trips outside of the city. Our room was large and very comfortable, with a private terrace outside that we used every evening. The hotel itself is clean, comfortable, and has every amenity imaginable for a wonderful trip to Madrid. I strongly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay there again if we return to the Spanish capital. Thank you, thank you to the entire staff of the Gran Melia Fenix!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDowntown
