Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a vacation trip in August. Paid extra for the spa tub room which did have a wonderful balcony but the water was not heated so was not really able to use the outdoor spa. I like Melia for the European charm and this hotel has loads of it; beautiful building. Room was well appointed and very clean.Room also had double windows so was very quiet with no street noise. Service staff was very friendly. The front door staff was the only real weakness as not very attentitive. Overall, I'd stay here again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant yet warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CorneliusC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Solmelia hotels in Palma and Seville, I decided to choose the Gran Melia Fenix for a three-night leisure trip to Madrid, and was not disappointed. From check-in to check-out, all the staff were unfailingly pleasant and helpful - and genuinely so. I chose a supreme room, which had an admittedly 'middling' view, over the Plaza de Colon, but it was worth paying the extra for a spacious room, complete with a huge bed, writing desk, comfortable armchair, iPod dock, and - very welcome at siesta time - a gorgeous chaise longue. The room was extremely quiet, and the bathroom was fine, with a very effective shower. I can't quite get to grips with the Melia pillows (two long and two square), but that's my problem! Breakfast offered a huge assortment of choices, including some typical Spanish items such as churros - everything from yoghurts and fruit to bacon and eggs. I can recommend the ensaimadas. Tea or coffee was served within moments by the friendly waiting staff. The hotel is in a very chichi part of town, close to e.g. Prada and Loewe boutiques, so shopaholics will be in seventh heaven. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, from cheap cafes to more expensive restaurants. The Prado etc. are a reasonable, and pleasant, stroll down the Paseos Recoletos and Prado, and personally, I liked the area; however, it is a little further to e.g. the Palacio Real and Plaza Mayor - but still manageable on foot, or you could grab a cab or the Metro. If I was visiting Madrid as a tourist again I might stay more to the west of the city, but otherwise I'd have no hesitation in returning to the Fenix, or in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Aquiraz
Reviews.Content: This location is the best: Calle Hermosilla at the corner of La Castellana, one block away from the Monument to Colombus. Walking distance to every place: El Prado, La Chueca, La Cibeles, La Puerta de Alcala, el Parque del Retiro, downtown... Simple and fast access to every corner of the city, and right at the Barrio de Salamanca, the "in location" to be in Madrid. The hotel is great... welcoming entrance, nice lobby, very good bar (the Hard Rock is there too... entrance on the back), the right rooms and nice and friendly people and service. The prices are also right... you can get some good deals, try it. It is the place I will stay very time I need to return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Ekoi
Reviews.Content: This is what a hotel should be: the service, the rooms, the food, the bar... What is there to add? This hotel is located in the heart of Madrid: the Retiro parc is a 500 m from it, so are all the beautiful boutiques. We went to Madrid to see the Real play. It was my birthday gift to my husband. I chose the Gran Melia because it was not too far from the stadium. I did not expect such old fashion luxury and reception. The staff is very efficient and will get you whatever you need and can recommend all the right sightseeing, specially for such a short trip. We will go back to this hotel, but for a longer stay. This hotel is as elegant as the city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “This is What a 5* Hotel is All About”
Reviews.Author: Mendonut
Reviews.Content: We have stay in this hotel many times, my favorite hotel in Madrid. Location: The best, just a rock throw away from Serrano St. (for shopping and dinning), and near to everything. We always walk to Puerta del Sol, a nice 15 minute walk. The Hotel: Common and reception areas look and are sparklingly clean. Everything always looks new and shinny. Staff: Superb and well trained personnel, very professional, discreet and accommodating, including the very respectful chambermaids. Flawless service (porters, reception and bar areas). Beautiful bar area. The room: Roomy, superclean, spacious, big size bed, heavenly bed and pillows, and amenities. Room service: Perfect presentation. One of the best meals I had on this trip. The restaurant is also very good, with a nicely price wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Guri
Reviews.Content: This was an exceptional experience! Great hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and professional. I will definitely consider this my favorite place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!! what a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: DRC1957
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for a good room at the red level . And this is my 3rd stay at this hotel.The room was supposed to be nicer that a standard room, and you have amenities like exclusive check-in at the 7th floor in a lounge that serves breakfast (great buffet + nespresso coffee) and from 11 am they keep all sorts of great finger food and drinks , as well as tea and coffee at the clients discretion. no extra charge. Free morning paper , and some other perks. At check in I am being told that I am getting an upgrade.......upgrades are always nice , but....they gave me the presidential suite. I was speachless. From then on, it was a sweet ride. I extended my stay by 2 nights (of course I had to pay up, but the suite and the service were worth it. I ll book this "red level" again next time....even if upgrade will probably not happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary service in Madrid with luxury and location”
Reviews.Author: MarinaGuy
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this hotel in the Red Level rooms. Probably one of the best experiences my wife and I have had in a hotel and we've stayed in many nice ones. The Red Level is pricey but well worth the luxurious rooms and unbelievable service.

Reviews.Title: “feel like a royalty”
Reviews.Author: FC111
Reviews.Content: Hospitality and the hotel location are perfect. I felt very "home-like" this hotel. Very classy and the service is outstanding. Extremely friendly and polite staff, especially Maria – Lady in Red, Jesus – the sweetest guy from reception and all of the staff members responsible for the breakfast. The Hotel is simply wonderful and you'll feel like a Royalty! And...the Dry bar and it's staff - absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A class of its own”
Reviews.Author: UncleSamDavid
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Fenix is a member of the "Leading Hotels of the World"; and yes, it is leading indeed. From the very first step into this fabulous place, you can see, feel, and even smell the distinction to other hotels. The always smiling, helpful porter leaves a perfect first impression, the friendly reception staff is attentive and makes you feel at home immediately. All the staff members of the Gran Melia have a particular greeting by putting their right hand over their hearts - that's something special! Talking special: The lobby even has its own scent. We learned that also in your room you have a choice of different scents - they actually have a menu for it! We have not seen this in any other hotel. We got a Leader's Club Upgrade to a Red Level Grand Premium Room with Jacuzzi, the check-in is done separately at the Red Level Lounge on the 7th floor. The lounge is also the place for the large breakfast buffet (7.30am to 11am) and offers an impressively well-stocked complimentary open bar and a variety of canapés from 1pm to 11pm. The amiable Red Level Staff is offering outstanding, personalized service on an excellent level. Most great hotels have one or two employees who take the extra step and provide supreme service; here at the Gran Melia everybody - the chambermaids, the room service, the technicians, the restaurant manager, the bar team, reception, lounge staff - everybody provides distinguished, first-rate service above expectations. To reach this kind of level - and keep it - is a brilliant achievement of the Gran Melia and well worth to be mentioned here. Our room was of appropriate size, tastefully furnished and had a private balcony and an outdoor Jacuzzi (good enough for two), which was a treat in the August heat of Madrid. They put two sun beds on our terrace, so we could start relaxing immediately. The large bathroom with separated toilet and bidet was equipped with Clarins amenities. Also notable: There were always enough fluffy towels available, and the housekeeping changes them two times a day. We greatly appreciated the free WLAN. Other hotels, even 5-star ones, still do charge for common service like this. This review wouldn't be complete without mentioning the hotel bar. A large counter shows the number of Dry Martinis served - if you order one, you'll get a certificate with your name and number on it. The bar has an indoor part and an outdoor lounge, which is open to the general public from 6pm on. There are so many luxury hotels in the world, it's not easy to stand out from the crowd. The Gran Melia Fenix however has achieved that distinguished level. That's why we think it is a class of its own.

Reviews.Title: “EXELLENT”
Reviews.Author: frank b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. From the service to the rooms. I would highly reccomend their own restaurant. Its a must !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Kate2005
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Gran Melia Fenix... The staff was incredible nice and our room - deluxe room - was amazing, clean and spacious. After been recused in a restaurant for not having reservation we went back to the hotel bar and ate there, and it was almost a gourmet experience... Very nice... We have nothing more to say unless we would stay again, next time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for stylish shopping and restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: SoBeachPalms
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: This location on Hermosilla was ideal. Close to all public transport, Plaza de Colon, and upscale shopping. Serrano street is 1 block behind hotel. Best shopping there, and also on all the side streets off Serrano. The trolley sightseeing bus also stops on the corner (recommend it for 2 days). HOTEL: PROS:Beautiful in an ornate way. Join their free Rewards Program (mas), when you check-in and you'll get 1 breakfast free for every 1 you pay for. The breakfast buffet is scrumptious, and probably the only good fresh fruit you'll get the whole time in Madrid. A great Italian restaurant down the street, La Nicoletta, was outstanding! Best meal we had the whole time. Very safe area. CONS: The outdoor hotel bar is busy at nights, and the drinks are very pricey. Can't get just a cup of coffee in the morning, my husband asked for 2 cups of coffee only at the breakfast buffet, and was charged 12 euros! Usually would be about 4 euros max! Rooms are small, but all are in Madrid hotels. No airport shuttle, neighboring hotel (Petit Palace Embassy) where our son stayed, had free airport shuttle and we used it with him to get to the airport, for free! The concierge desk wasn't very knowledgeable and had to Google for their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Above Avearge Hotel in Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: SayafK
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia Fenix was a very good Hotel, in a decent location close to great shopping and convenient to subways (Serrano and Colon), but as an avid Leading Hotels traveler, I must say I expected just a little more. I wouldn't completely write it off, when in Madrid again, as the staff, location and breakfast were very, very nice, but I didn't feel the overall hospitality that usually comes w/Leading Hotels. Here are some of the reasons for my verdict: Although early check in was honored, we still had to wait over an hour for the room to be made available (not really pleasant after a 14 hr. cross Atlantic commute). They allowed us to choose between two rooms (a very nice gesture) : A larger one w/view of a wall, and a smaller one, with a very nice view. Since view is very important to us, we ended up picking the smaller one, only to find out, it lacked a coffee maker (which would have been in place in the larger room as described in the details of our reservation) and an ironing board. They brought both AFTER we requested them, only to take away the ironing board the next day :( If room changes occur unexpectedly, they should be done w/the same amenities as would have been available in the original arrangement (IMHO:). Concierge was friendly but not so helpful. Example: WE requested a map of Segovia as we would be headed there the next day, only to be told "We have a map of Madrid, but not Segovia"... Well, w/in 5 minutes of the conversation I got on the PC and made a crude map of the requested city through the Trip Adviser website.... Hmmmm I found it odd that I could be so..... "Creative" in finding a map to a very popular destination nearby, but the concierge couldn't.... I should also mention recommendations for dining establishments were no different than what I had already found on Trip Adviser.. And in some cases directions were clearer online than through concierge. On the positive side, as mentioned before, the breakfast staff is fantastic, and pre-arrival correspondence is very prompt, professional and pleasant (Sandra and Sylvia in particular were outstanding :). OH, HUGE POSITIVE: Their fitness facility is under renovation so Gran Melia made arrangements for guests to use a nearby facility (Reebok Fitness Club 4 blocks away). Let me tell you, initially you may be turned off to have to leave the hotel for your workout...... UNTIL you get there.... ABSOLUTELY fantastic facilities. It's an upscale fitness club complete w/Steam rooms, state of the art equipment and with a tanning terrace worth visiting just for panoramic pics of Madrid. Worth going to JUST FOR pics off the terrace even if you're not working out (do wear gym attire if you go as you will not be admitted otherwise... Very, very impressive. I can't emphasize it enough. Gran Melia truly impressed me in this arrangement for it's guests. Hope this helps :).

Reviews.Title: “the staff made it a Very happy birthday”
Reviews.Author: agreekgodess
Reviews.Content: when we checked in the very nice front desk man noticed on my passport that it was my birthday, After wandering all around Madrid for the day we returned to our room to dress for dinner and we were greeted by a bottle of champagne on ice and a beautiful piece of cake. So thoughtful!! The room was lovely and the bed was so amazing we slept way too long. I would for sure stay here again.!

Reviews.Title: “very nice and spanish”
Reviews.Author: Justanotherguest
Reviews.Content: nice hotel , we had a corner suite, very nice and spacious, service is good, breakfast is very good, location is fine, lots of shops and restaurants nearby, a serious hotel. Fitness center was under renovation so we did not use. They accept small pets.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: yomeramera
Reviews.Content: Adapted in an old typical Madrid elegant building, this hotel has a lot of charm. It is just like a small version of Palace hotel in Madrid where a cozy lobby shows a stained glass at its roof. As you get in, you can see an exquisite, stylish and well preserved spiral stair and you can inmediately imagine what the athmosphere of this mansion was in its early days. Rooms are furnished following the epoque with lots of related details ( curtains, paintings, lamps etc) but well adapted to actual needs . Bed is comfortable with lots of pillows to choose from and a nice duvet. Bathroom is all marbeled with 2 sinks and the wc sepparated from the tub/bath area. Windows are soundproof and our room - I guess the others too- had double door so you cannot hear anything going on outside. Common areas as well as room corridors are in perfect shape: carpets, chandeliers etc. Breakfast as a buffet is quite acceptable with a good service: variety of fruits, cold meats, bakery, cheese and ommelets you can order. Location is great not just because you are at the most refined ( and shopping heart !) area in Madrid but because you have a Metro station just a block and a half away so you can go anywhere from there . Besides this,the hotel is just at the corner of La Castellana Av where you can find not only nice bars at its corridor itself but the main bus lines as an alternative transportation option. In summary, if you have the budget, do not hessitate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: robert08061963
Reviews.Content: Well located, with a nice large room, a confortable bed and a good bathroom, though the shower could definetely be better. Breakfast is fair, the average Spanish style but nothing special. And in case your bunsiness schedule allows, it is 15 minutes away from Puerta del Sol, very convenient .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slf27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and WOW, what an amazing hotel. We arrived early (around 9am) and were promptly able to check in (which was amazing, given the fact that not many hotels allow early check in). Our room was spectacular - the bed was a real queen/king bed (not the typical european push-two-twin-beds-together and call it a king type bed), the bathroom was really nice (covered in all marble), and the lobby was gorgeous. We got a great deal from DHR.com that included breakfast, which was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was very elegant, and offered over 150 items (which is great if you're a picky eater). The location is also great - right near the Metro, Prado and Park, and about a 10-15 minute walk to all other main attractions. Overall, I loved this hotel. I would absolutely stay here again, and would recommend this to anyone looking for a luxurious hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Ale3940
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Melia in mid-May with a friend, and for this hotel alone, I'd go back to Madrid. In short, it was the best hotel I've ever experienced and was clearly a Leading Hotel of the World. Our room was on the Club Floor, which is perhaps why it was so extraordinary. That floor includes a gorgeous breakfast spread (open until 11 each morning) of the most delicious, high quality foods: Iberian ham, fresh fruit, eggs, cereal, and every kind of beverage imaginable. In the afternoon, this club room has appetizers and snacks, changing throughout the day into the evening. Though I did not take advantage of the alcohol provided, I imagine that having a cocktail out on the club patio would be a delight. When we checked in, we were given private Club-Level check in. And they let us in our room several hours early since we had arrived from the States and the room wasn't occupied. That extra touch really made a difference! The room itself had a wonderful, private patio with a private jacuzzi. And it was a modern, clean, wonderful jacuzzi, just for our room, which they heated to our specifications! Imagine sitting in a hot tub outside underneath the Madrid stars--it doesn't get better than that. The beds were very comfortable, the room service was delicious, and all in all, it was a terrific stay. I can't wait to return. During our two-week European trip, our stay at the Gran Melia Fenix in Madrid was the highlight!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia, Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix for pleasure and found it to be a mixed bag. Located in an easily accessible area for sightseeing, walking and metro, the hotel is a generally well cared for, old-style property, and is appealing looking. The room, while nice, was quite small even for a "deluxe room with a view." While we were there, the fitness center was "under renovation," and the only thing originally offered guests as a replacement, was to go to a nearby health club for a fee. After discussion with the Manager, that fee was waved for us. Recommended city dining by the hotel staff fell short of expectations, as did our request for "must sees" in the area. Dining in the hotel was also generally sub-par, with the exception of the breakfast buffet, which was quite tasty. One odd thing that happened was that, during a rainstorm, the elevator shaft begain leaking and water literally poured out between the elevator car and it's door, thus shutting down one of the few elevators in the hotel. Finally, we were not told that we would have to endure the floor below us being painted. The fumes from this work traveled upwards into our room, creating an unbarable, toxic-like smell for 2 days. We kept the windows open during this time, but it was miserable none-the-less. So, would I stay at the Gran Melia Fenix again, probably not. However, I'd have to qualify my review, given the fact that some of the happenings during our stay were "anomalies."

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice, clean, fun”
Reviews.Author: nehapremjee
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel in Madrid- good standards, easily accessible to the rest of the city, well located. Great amenities within the hotel as well; i particularly liked the old charm of the sitting room outside. A little small, but not to the point where it is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle9406
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Really terrific young(ish) staff who will do all they can to help you. Rooms well appointed and spacious. Room service very good as is the restaurant and bars. Location of hotel is excellent, away from the noise, but close to all main sights and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: scunner67
Reviews.Content: just returned from a few days in Madrid. I often use the Leading Hotels of the World website or brochures to choose a hotel, and the one LHW recommended was the Fenix. The hotel is in a great position, it really is only 15-20 minutes away from the main sights, Prado, Retiro, city centre etc... and if you want, the metro is right outside, the buses too. The hotel is in a very upmarket part of town and is very pleasant to wander around these streets at any time. But what was even better was the hotel itself. We are big on hotel quality and this one did not disappoint in any way. I had booked a room with Red Level facilities, which includes a private check in, and private lounge facilities. The facilities were second to none, the lounge was very comfortable and spotlessly clean, there was an outdoor terrace where you can enjoy breakfast and champagne! The staff worked tirelessly to make ours (and everyone's) stay as first class as possible - everyone spoke perfect English, and were very understanding of my rudimentary Spanish - they could not have done more. Gemma especially made us so welcome on our first night, suggested where we could eat, even booked a flamenco show for us, told us exactly how to use the public transport, how much everything cost, which buses to take, which shops to go to, how to order tapas... everything in fact! If she is a product of the hotel chain's training programme, then my congratulations to them, they are obviously world class at this game! In fact there was no member of staff from porter, to doorman, to concierge to mamager who failed to impress with their high level of service and courtesy, always polite, smiling, eager to help.... a credit to the hotel and the Madrilenos I also considered staying at the Ritz for my visit - I mean no disrepect to that venerable institution, but I doubt they could have bettered this exceptional hotel on all counts. I would not stay at another hotel and will let everyone know who visits this city to book their stay here. Thank you FGM for a wonderful stay - I look forward to coming back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: The staff provided fast friendly and efficient service. The hotel offered a FREE breakfast that is by far the best and most extensive of any buffet breakfast I've had, everything was top class. Very centrally located, you can hop on the tour buses that take you around the city at the corner of the hotel. The Hard Rock Cafe is also attached to this hotel and provides a list of live shows that are performed right at the base of the hotel, this may be annoying for anyone wanting to get sleep during the day, the windows are pretty sound proof but not all the way. Room was excellent with a lot of attention to detail, internet is complementary but it is wired, wireless can be accessed in the lobby, free as well. I will definitely consider this my favorite place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A True Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: ToviHannanhJoah
Reviews.Content: From the professional staff at registration, to the lovely lady who provided turn-down service each evening, this hotel is well worth the price. Its location is excellent, and close to great shopping. It is a ten-minute taxi ride to the Prado, Sofia, and train stations. Guest rooms are very special -- luxurious in every way. The common areas are not only beautiful, but comfortable, as well. This was our first trip to Madrid and, in large measure, this hotel makes us want to visit again. Thank you Gran Melia, Anne and David Zimbler

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Area”
Reviews.Author: jeff3805
Reviews.Content: We spent several days here with our 3 kids. The hotel was close to shopping and the metro. We walked to many museums and the park. The service was great. We had breakfast included. It was quite a large buffet. The rooms were large and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Internet service was included. Our room was quiet. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and Solid Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ElMusaferain
Reviews.Content: We spent four very happy nights at the Fenix, an especially comfortable and welcoming hotel. We opted for a premium/views room, which was compact but well laid-out, with a separate vestibule off of which was the bathroom. The double-glazing and door from the room to this mini-hallway meant that it was one of the quietest hotel rooms I've ever enjoyed. Just enough closet space, although not enough drawers if two were to really want to unpack. Luxurious bed and bedding, and thick, large towels. Wired Internet only in the room (wifi downstairs), but free and adequately fast. The decor, in the rooms and throughout, is old-fashioned in a very good way - heavy curtains, gilded plasterwork, and the like, while the beautiful public rooms have the air of a slightly refreshed country house - bright colors and contemporary art setting off the stained-glass ceilings and sober paneling. Fresh flowers everywhere, but especially in the large lounge/bar at the back, brighten the place up nicely. Breakfast was a very nice addition - plenty of choices, excellent fresh juices and fruit, and a nice selection of hot and cold choices. We loved the location - a leisurely half-hour walk to the Prado, ten minutes to the heart of the trendy/gay Chueca district, just around the corner from upmarket Salamanca, and a short taxi from everywhere else (with a taxi always waiting outside). Finally, I can't say enough good things about the staff, who seemed uniformly professional, cheerful, and very happy to interact in English, in my terrible/non-existent Spanish, or even in French. The Gran Melia Fenix is by no means your cheapest option in central Madrid, but in this case you are definitely getting good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A great mini-break destination...”
Reviews.Author: ANMW
Reviews.Content: We came for a three-day trip and stayed, with our children aged 11 and 9, in two connecting superior rooms. Whilst it's true that the rooms are on the small side, and the floorplan configuration can seem a little odd, they are almost perfectly equipped. Our preferred aspect of the room was the large bed and wonderful bed linen. What we liked least was the lack of wi-fi in the room (available only in the lobby -- admittedly, for free) and the apparent lack of thermostat control on the a/c (either on or off, it seemed). The breakfast is as copious as described in other reviews. It's not of the highest quality, especially for a 5-star hotel, but it makes up for it in variety. The staff at the hotel seem to fall into two categories -- either upbeat and ready to help, or a little jaundiced. I sense that general management has not really created a universal culture of pride among the staff. Don't misunderstand me: this is a very pleasant hotel and we would recommend it. However, there is no real "Gran Melia Fenix" experience to distinguish this hotel from other 5-star hotels. Some reviewers have written that the hotel is well situated. This is true, especially if high-end shopping is your thing. It's a 25-30 minute walk into the historic part of town, however, which may be a consideration if you have small/young children. The metro is close, though, and it's cheap, clean, safe and simple to navigate, even for a foreigner. Taxis are abundant and good value for a family. On the subject of young children, the Hard Rock cafe is just around the corner from the hotel, offering huge servings of American food at very reasonable prices with waiters whose English is good. A blessing if you can't get your littl'uns to agree to another Spanish dinner. If museums float your boat, you're spolit for choice in Madrid. The local parks are also lovely. We also went to the nearby nature reserve (called "Faunia"). We were sceptical on the way over, thinking that it would be a disappointment, but the kids and we loved every minute of the four hours we spent there -- there's a wonderful selection of animals, many of which you see in very close proximity -- in a clever layout and with helpful signs in Spanish and English. Well worth the (admittedly steep) 25 euros per ticket. All in all, we enjoyed our few days in Madrid. It's a clean, relaxed and interesting city and well worth a trip. As mentioned, the hotel is to be recommended, but do research others to be sure you get what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zafulotus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, the staff is exceptionally and impressively friendly, the rooms are luxurious and well-appointed, free wifi. Would highly recommend. Only negative comment is the room service: the food was not noteworthy for the price. Otherwise, an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeGirl
Reviews.Content: Tiny room but with a grand double bed and tastefully decorated and comfortable. The best part of this hotel in my opinion, however, was the excellent location -- walking distance from some of the best shopping in Madrid (2 minutes up the street, all the best brands and designer shops as well as charming less-well known boutiques), and only a 5-minute walk from the National Archaeological Museum of Madrid (which is excellent!). You can walk to all the other main museums and tourist attractions if you like 20-30 minute walks, but a taxi is quick and fairly cheap. And a real plus are the many small restaurants in the area serving wonderful local dishes at reasonable prices (US$20 for soup, main course and a glass of house wine). Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bouchee
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the museums and just a few minutes from a subway stop, this hotel is a good choice for tourists. It feels more like a boutique than part of chain. Rooms have character, and the staff is exceptionally helpful. The other comparable choice is the Westin Palace, which is a bit closer to Plaza Santa Cruz and the museums. But this hotel has a smaller feel to it, and we liked it better. It's located closer to upscale shopping too.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fair”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located and Madrid is a very walkable city--you can easily walk to the major attractions. The restaurant in the hotel is quite good and has gluten-free designations on the menu. Service is excellent throughout with good bellmen, concierge, etc.. We had an interior facing room on the club floor. The club is nice and not much used. But the room is relatively small and the carpet is old (I kept stepping on a nail that was used to attach a loose piece, I guess). Air conditioning doesn't really adjust too well. I think the Westin Palace is better (although I think more expensive). Madrid is a noisy city so you need to be careful if you are noise sensitive about the room's location.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and up-market. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix Hotel in Madrid for a weekend break, and loved this hotel. It is a very stylish, smart and striking hotel with fabulous lobby area with sweeping staircase. The entrance does have a wow factor. The lobby leads through to a bar/ seating area with amazing ceiling, off here is the bar and also an ornate and smarter lounge bar (that serves fabulous cocktails!). The whole feel of the place is up-market, and it is (with some of the prices to match). The hotel is in a great location, close to many of the tourist attractions (like the Communications Palace and the Library) and also the open air tour buses go past very nearby. It is also in walking distance to the smart shopping streets, including the famous El Corte Ingles Department Store. The bedroom we stayed in (401) was very grand and plush, with massive and comfortable bed. The room had a great desk area, large TV, and iPod docking station and Clarins toiletries. The room had no view other than across to a building, but the room made up for that. We had access to to the business lounge, which was great. This has a dining area, sofa area and nice outside roof terrace. We had breakfast in there, which had a good spread - and also they had drinks and nibbles in the evening. The package we had also included wireless access, which is just as well as seemed to be very expensive to buy access. This hotel was a real treat and the service and attention to detail was outstanding. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location”
Reviews.Author: ZAP9
Reviews.Content: I go to this hotel any time I come to Madrid. The position is very good, near the Prado and Retiro. The staff is very friendly and always ready to help and provide advice on restaurants and attractions. The rooms are fine (although standard rooms are rather small), very clean and in very good state. The bed and linnen is very comfortable, and although it is in the Castellana that is a very busy avenue, rooms are very quiet. Breakfast is very good, with a wide variety of fruit, bread, cheese and pastries. The fitness center is rather small, but they are now renovating it, so it might improve. No swiming pool or spa. As expected, rates are quite high, but the hotel is really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: susanna_arashi
Reviews.Content: Hotel - 5 minute walk from the subway, very convenient - many shops (especially those luxury brands) around. you would love it if you like shopping - nice staffs Room - small, but clean Breakfast - I write this review because I want to let people know how delicious it is. YUMMY!! - large variety of food you can choose (even champagne!) - very delicious I would stay in this hotel if I go to Madrid again ^^

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llcooltone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a very reasonably priced suite in this hotel. The price included breakfast as well as complimentary cocktails and snacks until midnight. The location of this Hotel is excellent as it is near the main shopping district and away from all the noise of the museums which are only ten minutes away. While the hotel is very nice by European standards the service was quite simply amazing. My wife also agrees with others who have noted that the beds are extremely comfortable. she literally wanted to take the bed home with us.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great way to start a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TexasEd60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before moving onto the Canary Islands to pick up a cruise ship. This hotel is in a terrific location, everything is right outside the front door. The staff are all highly professional and the only concern they show is for the guests comfort and enjoyment. The hotel public areas are very intimate, sumptuous and inviting; the buffet breakfast is outstanding, the best we had on our 3 week trip. Our room was very comfortable but on the small side. We elected to upgrade to the Royal Service which provided nice benefits. Chief among them is that when we sleepwalked into the hotel the morning our flight arrived from the US, the staff immediately showed us to our room and at about 10 am we were in our comfy king bed and sound asleep. That meant a lot to us and was a good way to get started. The management and staff are world class.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, shame about the view!”
Reviews.Author: Kezbomb_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel, food and staff were all great, the view from the room was awful. They gave us a room that overlooked what looked like a staff smoking area! Not what I imagined I'd be looking at from a beautiful room in a five star hotel. We only stayed one night!

Reviews.Title: “absolutelly fantastic Leading Hotel of The World”
Reviews.Author: Mariah76
Reviews.Content: It has been an unforgetable stay in Madrid because this lovely hotel. 3 min to the best shopping area and 10 min to the museums. I loved the service, tranquility and an employee told me the secret: they care a lot the mix between groups and individual travelers...woooww Really I felt a focus on full service and LHW touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Shrugg
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Madrid and we'd booked for two nights.......... could have easily stayed a week! We arrived early but not only were we allowed to check in (huge benefit) but we got an upgrade on our room too. Reception staff (Jesus) were extremely helpful and friendly, and spoke good English. The room including bathroom was lovely and the black out curtains worked a treat as we slept in on the first morning and missed breakfast. Hotel bar for a cocktail is worth a visit (much better than Hard Rock Cafe)and whilst pricey at 14 euros I had one of the best Mojitos I've ever had. Metro is virtually ouside the hotel as is the bus stop for the open top bus tours (17 euros each) alternatively a 15 minute walk gets you into the centre. The handwritten welcome note from the manager was just one of the things that put this hotel above many I have stayed in - the chocolates helped too! We'll certainly visit Madrid again and definitely stay at Gran Melia Fenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADL79
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient staff, well appointed rooms and bathrooms, took dinner in the bar which was limited choice but friendly service. A high end hotel offering a decent price. Very happy to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “For the cost, it can't be beat any where in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Rutman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels around the world, including the renowned Connaught in London. This is on par with the best, only at a fraction of the cost. The staff is simply amazing. I would recommend upgrading to their premium rooms, you won't be disapponted. I will happily return to this hotel the next time I want a romantic retreat in Madrid! The only, and I mean the only, negative is their fitness room, it is pathetic. It doesn't even have a full set of barbells. We primarily booked the hotel because we are workout freaks and wanted a hotel with a fitness room and because of the great ratings it received on Trip Advisor. We didn't work out once! That said, I would skip working out to stay here again! If they ever upgrade the fitness room this hotel will then have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prova113
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be fantastic-a really lovely experience. We stayed on the 'club floor' on level 7. The service was first rate-we were assisted by a very friendly and knowledgeable lady, Cristina, who was absolutely fantastic. The breakfast here was outstanding, and the lounge downstairs is also very nice. The room was fantastically comfortable & had lovely Etro bathroom products.We will certainly stay here again and would gladly recommend it. However, at this price level Wi-Fi internet access should be included.

Reviews.Title: “It was an unexpected visit for just married”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry100
Reviews.Content: Iberia delaited with its flight and my wife and I spent the night in the hotel. It was another night added to our honey moon! Great decoration and furniture in old classic style. King size bed. Friendly and professional stuff. Thanks a lot for the hospitality. If I need to stay in Madrid I'll try to find good price proposal for that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Opulence in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia is an opulent traditional hotel with traditional service right in the centre of Madrid. Ideal if you like grand, overstated rooms. Great bar service. Rooms can be too hot too often

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid if you enjoy space”
Reviews.Author: WorldGlobetrotter_8
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are small and the double beds even smaller. My partner and I 'slept' in a small double bed, which ensured that neither of us got a restful night's sleep during our stay. Paid a lot of money for a hotel which whilst well decorated, struggles because it just does not have the space.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: dcp_7
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay for a weekend here. The service was great - the gentleman on the reception was friendly and efficient and could not do more to help. The room had everything we needed and we enjoyed the jacuzzi bath. The room was a little jaded in places (minor maintenance needed only) but it is a old style hotel and cleanliness could not be faulted. Best thing is the location, right in the heart of the upscale shopping and great restaurants two minutes away. When returning to Madrid next year it will be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and furnishings”
Reviews.Author: greenrobert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night after our flight was cancelled by Iberia. Considering I didn'y pay a penny, the hotel was stunning. Almost made up for the 8 hour queue at Madrid Airport to get the flights rebooked! The rooms are very nice with fantastic beds. If I were to come to Madrid again and the price was good, I would stay here agin without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a budget”
Reviews.Author: NWSenior
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel again using a secret rooms deal and were very pleasantly surprised to be upgraded from a deluxe to a premier room. The room design was classically elegant, with sumptuous furnishings and a large comfortable bed. The bathroom was delightfully decorated with black and cream marble tiles with a fantastic range of toiletries, very much appreciated when only travelling with hand luggage. Admittedly there was some work going on in the road outside, but the sound proofing is excellent by virtue of double double glazing, so no problems there. The location is very convenient with Colon Metro across the road and a short walk found us in a charming though exclusive shopping area. All in all excellent service and fabulous value for money. We will definitely be back when next in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: justhadtosay
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get this hotel for a good price through lastminute.com's secret hotels. It was certainly a good deal, it is a very elegant building, beautifully decorated in an old fashioned, cosy sort of way. We seemed to be given the 'cheap' room which was a bit cheeky as all the offers we saw on the internet were about the price we paid. We did however complain about our lack of heating and were moved to a much better room wo were very happy. The staff are generally very helpful. The rooms are lovely, bed was very comfortable, we had a great night's sleep. There is no coffee or tea in the room though which was one big downside. The room service etc is good but incredibly expensive. There is a very pleasant bar in the hotel but the drinks we had came in at e12 Each, bit over the top even for a five star. Prices generally in Madrid are very high and the standard doesn't really match it compared to London. Meal s out are very expensive. However the area around the hotel has some very good bars/restaurants etc, just dont forget the credit card. One big downside of Madrid and this hotel is that smoking seems socially acceptable virtually anywhere and everywhere! It seems to be legal in restaurants, bars, you name it. A very pleasant lounge became very unpleasant due to cigar and cigarette smoke. There are no smoking areas in restaurants but to be honest its a bit of a farce when half the room will be for smokers. It is a fabulous city though, very lively in the evenings, with a lot to see. It is friendly. The tube system is great, very quick and clean with a two euro trip from the airport, excellent. It was chilly at night and can be cold during the day but often sunny which is such a lift during November!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: cleoniki
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was really nice, good service, delicious breakfast. Not a central hotel but you can walk 15minutes to the centre or take a taxi which is cheap. Good relation with the price. The only thing that did not like was that you have to pay for the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Left failing to see what all the hype is about”
Reviews.Author: K30
Reviews.Content: I must say after reading all of the beaming reviews here on TA I was a little disappointed with this hotel. It is nice enough, don't get me wrong, but my experience failed to live up to the palacial standards I was led to believe I would encounter. It is worth mentioning however the location is truly excellent - very close to metro, decent restaurants and of course all the sites. Firstly, and importantly, this place is a building site at the moment. They are crashing around on the street (they are literally tearing up the road just outside) and in the hotel at all hours of the day, and as such there is dust and dirt all over the communal areas of the hotel. The reception area is also pretty small and failed to overwhelm me - in fact I was more impressed with the foyer at the Holiday Inn at LHR. To be honest the whole place needs a good clean and repaint after all the work is finished. Our room was well decorated and appointed but tiny, and oddly we were given a disabled room so everything in the bathroom was really low - not a real problem for most but we are both 6 feet tall! There was also a lack of natural light owing to the enormous and permanently closed curtains. The array of toiletries and traveller amenities are exceptional, I have never seen so much stuff next to the sink in the bathroom. There is however no coffee/tea making facility in the room. The bed was without doubt comfortable and we both slept soundly - except that maid service starts at ridiculous times, we had them walk in (without knocking) as early as 7.45am. They are friendly enough though, and do a great job. I feel like I have whinged a lot, which I don't normally do, however I feel that the previous reports are overly gushing and do not represent what I encountered. Despite the whining, I would recommend to a friend, but I would not be as complementary as others have been.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TrishLeeds
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Gran Melia Fenix and once again it did not disappoint. The staff are wonderfully helpful and friendly and the rooms luxurious and very comfortable. We will stay here again next time we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “sloppy service lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: follistown
Reviews.Content: just back from three nights in this nice Hotel . I had read my trip advisor reviews so it looked good to stay in . I had requested Strawberries and Champagne on arrival to suprise my wife who had nursed mr through a serious operation .Despite having emailed previously and asked at reception it took three more calls to get it delivered at that stage the suprise was ruined . Overall the hotel is very nice but struggles to be a 5 star with this sloppy service the room was lovely but the bathroom was very small and cramped, John Navan ireland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: lmf26
Reviews.Content: If you want refined service, knowledgable staff, good food and location then this is your place. I was the Gran Melia Fenix for close to two weeks and not one word of complaint. I found everyone to be genuine and smiles opened conversation easily as my boyfriend was busy working away for business. I had to locate a car for travel and one of the ladies spent over an hour with me and the company ensuring my needs were met. This was greatly appreciated and not expected at all. Would consider this a hotel a home away from home because that is the feeling that is left behind. The management should be very proud of their team.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: SDV744
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Gran Melia Fenix at the start of a two week vacation. What a wonderful way to begin our trip. We chose a "Royal Service Accommodation" room. Although more expensive, an excellent breakfast buffet, complimentary snacks and drinks ( including alcoholic beverages) in a private lounge, and personalized concierge services made the extra expense well worthwhile. Early check in was included in Royal service. We had alerted the hotel that we would be arriving in Madrid at 9:00 AM . They were expecting us and quickly got us into our room . After an overnight flight, this was greatly appreciated. The room was well appointed and decorated, sound proof, and immaculately clean. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. While not overly large, the room was luxurious. The bath was exceptionally well appointed although quite small. The level of service was extraordinary. We completed a pre arrival questionnaire sent by the hotel to understand our preferences. These were all acknowledged and attended to. The hotel knew that part of the reason for our travel was my wife's birthday. We returned to our room one night to find a wonderful gourmet mousse cake, fresh berries, and a bottle of iced cava waiting us. The hotel is located in easy waking distance of excellent restaurants and about 15 minute walk to the Prado. It would be wonderful if the hotel had an indoor pool, but even without, this is a great hotel. I think it would appeal most to those who value quiet old world style luxury and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “I was so comfortable I almost felt I was home in my own bed!”
Reviews.Author: gormport
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a lovely place to stay and has modern "old world" charm. Our room was an adequate size, well appointed, very clean, and the bathroom was marble. The beds were so comfortable. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. It was a 10 minute walk to the Prado. I would not consider staying any where else in Madrid except Gran Melia. Fran Gorman Long Island, New York

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rojer63
Reviews.Content: What a luxurious hotel this is. Everything about the hotel is fantastic - from the staff who work there, to the communal areas and the rooms. We certainly hope to repeat our visit there!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous !!”
Reviews.Author: cocolina61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old world glamour just like a hotel should be .Some of the best reception staff ive ever come across . The rooms are clean well equipped and comfortable and ALL the staff were excellent efficient and smilely. Our breakfast was lovely ,a selection of both hot and cold buffet and super pastries. The public spaces are beautiful and a pleasure to be in and it all looks exactly like the website photos. Great location ask the reception staff for the public transport info we found this the best way to get everywhere bus stops right by the hotel and are fast and go everywhere. This hotel is Fab although it probably isnt the place for you if you want hustle and bustle bright lights and monocrome. Just old fashioned charm and elegance. Perfect......

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: ordep
Reviews.Content: This hotel located on the Plaza Colón is very central. You will reach the "golden triangle" (Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums) with a 1/2 hour walk. LIKED Room view (room 517) over Plaza Colón Decoration Bed Lights Breakfast Buffet Safe large enough for 2 laptops (14') Amenities in bathroom TV set Video surveillance in corridors Cleanliness DISLIKED room service prices (€7 for a coffee, tea or beer!) Internet wireless not free No direct acess to garage from the hotel Room keys didn't work (6) Bathroom too small Closet too small Works in Hermosilla street (Hotel entrance)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does it all RIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: choco_nut_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 week driving trip through Spain. We started and ended our trip at the Gran Melia Fenix. From our first minute at the hotel, we were greeted by the most wonderful staff that could not seem to do enough for us. They were so gracious. We had a beautiful room for 4 nights in a very clean, well kept, luxury hotel. The staff sent us to an amazing restaurant that was not a tourist trap. When we asked for help finding a wine tour they sent us to a very small, family run, private winery. This was an experience no other hotel would have provided. After our first 4 nights at the hotel we left and stayed at 5 other hotels in Spain. Most of these were the best hotel in each city. When we arrive back in Madrid and entered the hotel, it felt like we were returning home. the staff greeted us with open arms and it was very sad to leave. The only possible thing to say that would have been better is if the hotel had king size beds. They only had queen but these were fantastic. I would tell everyone that this hotel was our best experience in Spain and probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan22
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Gran Melia Fenix during August. What a treat. The hotel is beautifully decorated and air conditioned throughout - a real must during August. It is an expensive hotel compared to what you can find elsewhere but like most things you pay for what you get. Polite charming staff, tastefully decorated hotel throughout and superb breakfast. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. If you can afford stay at this hotel it's a real treat. The GM Fenix Hotel and staff deserve every success during these difficult times. I will have no hesitation in booking into this hotel if I visit Madrid again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy here! 5 star service & great location”
Reviews.Author: 4-Buena-Vida
Reviews.Content: I was very happy here! This hotel does a great job, well kept, classic style with modern comforts, very good service in a festive country like Spain (that sometimes lacks in service and english skills) service & great location in the middle of old and new Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Freddy_7
Reviews.Content: We were able to upgrade to a premium room for a low cost after getting a good lastminute deal on a standard room, which was a bit small. I travelled with my 17 year old daughter and we were both impressed by the welcome we received and the comfortable and spacious accommodation. A quiet, cool oasis in a hot city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Awesome Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: junkie_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia recently. The hotel is very centrally located - a little away from the tourist rush in Plaza Colon. The rooms are a good size, plush with great views of Plaza Colon. Windows are double paned, so its very quiet inside the room although the hotel overlooks a busy plaza. The bed, pillows et al are very comfortable. We chose a package that included breakfast - the spread was simply awesome. The concierge in the hotel was very helpful with reservations, directions etc. Great shopping is only minutes away at Serrano. We took the metro to get from the airport to the hotel. The Serrano station is a short walk from the hotel. Cabs are fairly cheap - it took about 6ish Euros to get to any of the attractions. The only con I noticed were the not so clean carpets. I could not help but notice the dusty and dirty edges of the carpets. Gran Melia should do a better job in cleaning the carpets more often. O

Reviews.Title: “2* service in a garishly lavish setting. FOR OLD PEOPLE ONLY”
Reviews.Author: Hswann
Reviews.Content: My partner and I (aged late 20s) stayed here as part of a 'Top Secret Hotels' deal on Lastminute.com. We paid £100 per night for a standard double room instead of the normal £200. Still nowhere near a good deal. The place looks like something from the 1950s - not in the stylish trendy sense, but in the garish, overly lavish way. it's like someone tried to imitate the Ritz and failed. Gold everywhere, not a single inch of space untouched by some sort of decoration. When we stayed, a conference group was also staying, and we had to fight our way through tens of loud business men and women smoking, chattering, and taking up all of the staff's attention. There was even a cheap looking table set out in reception with a note board behind it, announcing the timetable for the conference. Not five star treatment for us at all. We booked a double room and requested a double bed ('cama matrimonial' - make sure you request it on every trip as a couple in Spain or there's a good chance you'll be given twin beds). They said they'd run out but could push the twin beds together for us, or, for 40 euros we could get a room with a double bed and a nicer view. Nice - upselling in our first few minutes in the hotel. They weren't bothered at all and barely tried to help. And we had to stand in the bedroom and wait whilst the staff made the bed for us. Classy. The room was cramped, the bathroom was tiny, and the air conditioning didn't work. There was a snazzy machine by the bed to control lights, air con etc. that didn't work either. Because of the air con, we complained and it took them half a day to move us to a room with a double bed (beware - the double beds are small). One of the staff on the concierge desk was helpful (young guy named Jesus) but apart from that they were condescending, unhelpful and rude. I filled in a complaint form which guaranteed that if they hadn't repaired our aircon or changed our room within 1 hour they'd offer us a free night or a refund. Needless to say i heard nothing back from them. Location isn't great for sight seeing - you need to take Metro or Taxi to see anything worth a visit. Room service is incredibly expensive, as is laundry. No swimming pool (how can this place really be 5*??) and internet is only free in the business centre. REALLY DISAPPOINTING - don't waste your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddicts2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to nice restaurants, and shopping. Excellent room, service and the bedding is amazingly comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel for Luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Perfect service......”
Reviews.Author: CesarAlonso
Reviews.Content: Maybe is not the best hotel in Madrid, but all together , is a perfect place, very good service, the food is so fresh, the rooms are ok, and the location is perfect, it really worth every cent spend there

Reviews.Title: “could not think of a better place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cakdemir
Reviews.Content: In the middle of shopping area of serrano, Gran Melia Fenix offers everything of what a five star hotel should deliver. Location is A+, service quality A+, rooms&decoration A+... very friendly staff.. upgraded to a premium room - very spacious... definitely be my choice for my future madrid trips. would not look anywhere else. other than the hotel, try Lateral cafe for tapas in velazquez ave..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in every respect and an ideal place to stay in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: wpdame3
Reviews.Content: Located on the lovely, wide Paseo Castellana, and not some crowded, noisy side street, the Gran Melia Fenix is a very nice blend of luxury and, value. The service, from the front desk to every level, was impeccable. The rooms are well proportioned and beautifully furnished. One amazing feature that helps the housekeeping staff, not the guest, is that a touch of a button raises the sleeping surface of the bed in order for the maid to make it at chest level, without bending over! The amenities are plentiful and of excellent quality. The laundry service is one of the quickest and best I have experienced in any hotel. The buffet breakfast is of astonishing range and quality and included in the room price. The bar and lounge is a lively and well appointed gathering place, but fairly pricey, as you might expect. Only negatives: they need to replace worn elevator buttons and expand the size of the Business Center! Located only about a 15 minute walk from the Prado, this is a well managed property, offering excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Impresive Service”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: I just finished a family trip and stayed twice during that time at this property. Servicio Real (their executive floor) is amazing. The service is above and beyond what is expected. As soon as you get to the hotel they send you to the seventh floor where your keys are ready and the sweet ladies in charge already know your name. Rooms are of good size considering European standards but the toilet space (not the bathroom) is a joke. On my way back on the plane I asked my wife if the planes bathroom was larger or I got used to small spaces. It is really small. Location is perfect in central Madrid close to Metro, Taxi, restaurants and La Paz Market. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NSU2010
Reviews.Content: excellent stay recently. Free room upgrade and excellent attention to detail. Wonderful marble bathroom and Bang and Olufsen TV etc.. Staff very helpful and location perfect for little disturbance at night. As with many 5 star hotels avoid minibar due to exorbitant charges. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: slamsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Gran Melia for 5 days for a hotelier conference. Flew out of Helsinki and was supposed to arrived into Madrid at 8pm but my flight got delayed as there were an ongoing strike with the Paris air traffic controller, finally arrived in Madrid at midnight. I was glad that the hotel was exquisite as i was tired. Staffs were very warm eventhough i arrived late. Breakfast was a good spread, a lot of healthy choices which was perfect for the morning. Everything went smoothly until an extraordinary happen. I was supposed to attend a Gala dinner on the last night of the conference and had a pair of stone earrings with me. I noticed that the stone from the earrings got detached when i took it out from the jewellery pouch. I placed it neatly in the bathroom vanity top. Due to the hectic schedule, I often forgot to take it to reception meaning to ask them to help me find a glue. On the 2nd last night when i got back to the room, i was pleasantly surprised that the stone had been glued. I went down to reception and ask the reception who was the lady who make-up my room. I cant remember her name anymore but I want to thank her for that initiative or gesture that she has done for me. She made my day with just a simple initiative. I stayed in room 329 from the 13 - 17 Jan 2010. Kudos to the GM of Gran Melia Fenix for having a wonderful staff. Staff like that are valuable and definitely a great asset for the hotel. She's a gem and thank you again! Will definitely recommend the hotel to anybody who wants to visit your beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Nice”
Reviews.Author: kellycrystal
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Gran Melia Fenix. The room was very nice. I enjoyed the pillow menu - so I could get my favorite type of pillow. The gym was very mediocre, but I was happy they had one. Overall it was a great stay. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJFrier
Reviews.Content: Hotel has outstanding location very close to the city centre, just next to Plaza de Colon. Staff is very friendly and efficient. We loved having drinks on a bar in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Gewitter
Reviews.Content: Friendly staf, beautiful hotel (room a bit small, but ok), great breakfast, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels "LOW RATE GUARANTEE" is NOT Guaranteed.”
Reviews.Author: likedetails
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to Madrid for my birthday and researched many hotels. I almost booked the Ritz but was getting a better deal with Gran Melia Fenix for their "Royal Service" rooming option. After reserving the hotel, I was scowering the net for the usual tourist info on things to do and came across a website that was offering an additional 15% off the same room I booked. Ah ha I thought! What luck!! Since the Sol Melia ADVERTISES a LOW RATE GUARANTEE, I'll send them a claim form. Uh-oh, they "kindly" informed me they couldn't honor the rate because the sites "cancellation and payment policy" doesn't match their's! "Huh?" What the heck does cancellations and what payment options I use have to do with the fact that the exact same reservation I made is $400 less than the low rate guarantee you offer your customers? Oh, and when they checked the website, they couldn't find what I was talking about. I had taken a screenshot of the travelnow.com discount and saved it to my word doc so I replied to them with it PLUS I pointed out that the travelnow.com website indeed have the same policy as them - travelnow.com DOES NOT CHARGE A CHANGE OR CANCELLATION FEE up until the day BEFORE your arrival. They only impose the HOTEL PROPERTIES cancellation policy which they have to pass on to the customer's. The ONE difference that apparently VOIDED SOL MELIA'S "LOW RATE GUARANTEE" was due to the fact that TRAVELNOW.COM charges your card UPFRONT for the reservation (even though there is NO PENALTY TO CANCEL OR MODIFY YOUR RESERVATION UP UNTIL 24 HRS BEFORE ARRIVAL) but Sol Melia charges you on the day of check-out! WOW. Sol Melia, if you DON'T want to refund folks their money, PLEASE TAKE OFF THE LOW RATE GUARANTEE YOU ADVERTISE! It only makes you look bad. BTW folks, I haven't heard from them since I sent in my screenshot....i will keep you posted. BTW - while purusing the web, I found an even BETTER option (especially for folks with families) renting a Madrid Apartment! WWW.SPAIN-SELECT.COM have WONDERFUL apartments, all 5 star reviews...worth looking into, more options (due to full amenities like kitchen, microwave, fridge etc... if you have kids and need to keep stuff stocked). I was blown away by what I could enjoy for less money than one of these hotels! I'm sure many of you seasoned traveler's probably know about the apartment option but wanted to point it out for other folks who may not know. Thanks and I will keep you guys updated on this low rate guarantee business... BTW: Just to clarify again, I haven't stayed here so I cannot rate it based on that...just posting an update!

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond belief and comfort in the face of adversity”
Reviews.Author: BOBDNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix last month and whole heartedly recommend this hotel. We booked a Luxury Link package which included a room with a terrace and hot tub along with their royal service lounge, etc. Check in was personal and amazingly fast with Laura being the perfect hostess. The room was beautiful and the view was great. The next morning (it had rained the night before) there was a leak in the ceiling of our room, so we need to move. And we moved, and moved, and moved. I admit that I was a tad cranky (and jet lagged I imagine but management kept at it, trying to find us accomodations which were suitable. They were relentless in their quest to please! Even Laura (who was working downstairs at the front desk as opposed to the concierge desk kept inquiring about "her guests". In short what was a series of mishaps were made much better by a few truly amazing customer service-oriented employees. We finally wound up in a huge suite overlooking the plaza. Initially the hot tub on the terrace was not functioning (I know - not a lot of sympathy here). Miraculously they did get it working! The food in the restaurant was superb, the lounge was great and again, the staff - and especially Laura - were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: StefR
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Fenix is a perfectly fine hotel but it is by no means a 5 star property. We stayed over the New Years week and paid for an upgraded package that included access to the lounge. While the room is quite nice, the service is lacking. The staff are courteous but not always helpful. Case in point there were never enough umbrellas (something other 5 star hotels seem to have no trouble handling), the limited options in the lounge were almost never stocked and finally the conceirge desk staff was rarely manned. I had to wait more than 30 minutes to check out and then had to point out that they had overcharged me. The front desk staff were not at all apologetic or quick about fixing the error. The hotel is situated in an upscale but slightly out of the way area of Madrid if you've come to visit Old Town Its about a 20-30 minute walk to the Prado, Old Town and other sites. There is a metro stop just 2 blocks away which requires you to transfer to get to Old Town but their metro is very easy to use so we had no issues getting around. The room itself was small very nicely decorated in a classical way. Our king bed was actually two twins pushed together which I didn't really appreciate in an upgraded room but only a small problem. The room was very clean. Overall, this isn't a bad hotel in any sense - its just not a 5 star property. I think we could have easily paid less to stay at a 4 star property and had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with charm and character. Recomended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Txiquitin
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel: 5 stars are a weel representation of its quality and service. Location is perfect, close enough of downtown Madrid, and just side by side with the best museums, and shopping area of Goya. I am from Madrid, so I know teh city well...but this time wanted to spent a romantic night in a good hotel . Totally worth it! Breakfast was included (in the room!) , so the night was perfect. Room was not huge, but decent. My only "complains": my room did have views to an awful interior patio, and bathtub was too small for two. Staff super friendly and helpful...for those who needs their help. Totally recommended. I have to say that I found a deal online for this hotel, that is why the value is 5 starts...not really know it regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BJGfrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel centrally located. PROS: Nice beds larger rooms, helpful staff and a good location. CONS: Room was getting a little worn. Nothing special...Blah. If you get an interior room like I it looks into a vent shaft. Do not open the windows in the vent shaft because you may be overcome by somone elses bathroom smell "yes I mean THAT". Bottom Line: I would stay again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid in Spring”
Reviews.Author: tourists4ever
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Madrid for three days on our way to Germany and the Gran Melia Fenix was a perfect place to stay, it is centrally located to all attractions, culture centers , shopping, dinning all within walking distance, we took a taxi to and from the airport for 26.00 EU The hotel has clean, confortable rooms, internet in your room for 8.00 EU a day, excellent breakfast buffet, lovely seating areas, nice lobby and a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “They earn all 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: onetreamigas
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Fenix is a great hotel. I recently stayed there with two other family members and we all agreed. The service is excellent. Our room was lovely, a bit small for three, but very nice just the same. Breakfast was great and the service was the best. They couldn't do enough for you. The hotel is located in one of the better districts of Madrid. Travel to sites via Metro, (bid red) bus, and cab was easy. All in all I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite five-star but top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix for four nights at the end of a trip to Spain, and enjoyed it. The entire hotel feels a bit dated for something that was remodeled less than 10 years ago and the rooms are a tight squeeze (Spanish-style), but good value for the dollar overall. We found the staff consistently very prompt and responsive to any request (such as an ethernet cable...no wifi in the rooms), the location to be good despite the construction in the immediate neighborhood, and the buffet breakfast topnotch. Also enjoyed things like a firm mattress and great water pressure, which can't be taken for granted. A good deal especially when booked through Leading Hotels of the World.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - great food - no problems”
Reviews.Author: TonyClark65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 28 Sept - 3rd Oct 2009 (5 nights). Had a free upgrade pass so got really good rooms. First thing I did was ak reception to clear the mini-bar so we could use it as a fridge and suprisingly a maid arrived to do it within 5 mins and there was no charge. There is a nasty sign on the minibar saying anyhing moved would be charged but reception were OK as I had tried to manouevre some space and had dislodged some items. Apart from this sign we were made to feel very welcome, and everyone spoke good English. The breakfasts are superb - the best I have had in 10 years - the waiters are very accommodating eg. we asked for chilled milk for cereal and this was no problem. The maids do get a bit carried away with the slippers they leave you - after we returned to our room every night two fresh pairs plus small sheets would arrive - but we never asked or used them. Got the usual chocolates too - would have been nice if they had left us a bottle of wine/champagne as we got in Nice last year. There have been a lot of comments about bar prices - yes theya re expensive - but worth paying 7 or so Euros for a small beer to sit on the terrace when it's sunny - we got a selection of nuts free every time - very tasty! The hotel is very conveniently placed. We got 2 day tourist bus passes for 22 euros each and commuted this way - the bus stop is right outside. Madrid itself was spoiled by so much road works when we were there - if you ever wan't to see sewer/trench/piling works at first hand this is the place to be - you can get within inches of workmen - they don't close streets like in the UK, just narrow them. My advice is to go to Barcelona rather than Madrid - Barcelona is more fun and there is a higher proportion of tourists to business people. Also you have to search quite hard for good restaurants in Madrid - we did find just enough but they are not plentiful where we were. Top tip - from the Airport get the No. 200 bus (only one Euro and every 15 mins) and it takes you to the central bus station where you can get a taxi for about 7 Euros. If you get a taxi from the Airport to the hotel it will cost you about 30 Euros. Overall was a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury honeymoon / romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: TexasKPB
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Spain and I am glad I did my research on Trip advisor since it paid off. I went here with my new husband and we stayed 2 nights in the room with the private jacuzzi on the balcony. If you choose this room you get a private concierge with a complimentary breakfast and snack bar on the other side of the hotel. The hotel was spotless and all the amenities we needed were in the room: blow dryer /iron / AC - you could control temp / fridge / complimentary toiletries. We opted for the relax and romance package and got a bottle of champagne with strawberries and complimentary dinner. I am from Texas, USA and I have stayed in many nice hotels in the US but this hotel service was unlike I had experienced in terms of service. There is a bellman out front complete with a top had valet and everything was a dream. No street noise and you have complete privacy! Felt like we were in a glamourous movie - WILL RETURN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siouxknox
Reviews.Content: Fully worth its four star rating. Beautifully decorated, impeccably clean, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on. Our room faced the street but noise was not a problem due to two double paned windows--yes, four panes of glass keep the outside world away. Though conveniently located in a pleasant area with upscale stores, it is a short walk to the usual tourist attractions--the Prado was a 15 minute walk and the Puerta del Sol was 20 minutes. These are easy and pleasant walks, but if that's too much the hotel is also right next to the subway which is fast, safe, easy to use and goes absolutely everywhere. Though the breakfast buffet looked lovely, we thought the 27E per person price was too much, and we had plenty of fine choices in the neighborhood, including one place right across the street from teh front door.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lrincon
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents what service and attention are all about. The rooms are very comfortable and impecable. The staff is very efficient and cordial. We truly enjoyed our stay and we would recommend it to anyone visiting such a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a bit overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: montydogStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran for 3 nights for our first time to Madrid. The hotel itself is nice and quite opulent but the room we were alloced was quite small and overlooked a stairwell, but hey you are not there to look at the view. There was an unfortunate noise though in the middle of the night of what sounded like an ice making machine churning out ice and dropping in the containers.
