This happened on several occasions throughout the night, we were on the 3rd floor next to an emergency exit. We could also hear a slight hum of the air conditioning generators from the outside. Breakfast was okay but a little strange on the cooked breakfast - pasta anyone???The breakfast room was quite small and staff took a little while to bring coffee to you, we heard a guy complain that he had been waiting almost 20 minutes for an eggs benedict. Breakfast was included in our package, I would have been very disappointed if I had to pay extra. There are lots of seated areas, an outside courtyard and we saw Fabio Capello have a coffee and a meeting with other gentlemen. He looked slightly miserable, maybe he had the pasta!!! Madrid has lots of lovely little bars with amazing tapas and we ate at the oldest restaurant in the world (so the Guinness World Records say!) called Botin Restaurant which is not far from the Sol Metro. Would we come back to Madrid, yes without a doubt, would we come back to this hotel - probably not. We had high expectations but it slightly let us down and its overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CCJB_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Madrid with my family, brother and parents. We felt as we were in our own home! Meliá Fenix is very good located next to Museo del Prado, Cibeles Fount.... And it is next to Hard Rock Cafe Madrid. The service is perfect, the bed increadible confortable!!!! Very good breakfast as well! We really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a 5* hotel? You've found it.”
Reviews.Author: oznini
Reviews.Content: We chose a superior room on Booking.com and we got exactly what we paid for. ...except for the view! Plaza Colon is under construction at the moment, so the view is not great! In fact everything that was described on the website was in the room, even the soundproof windows. Beautiful room very nicely decorated with a floor to ceiling marble bathroom. A bit small but beautiful anyway. The staff was really nice and spoke very good English. Unfortunately we had to pay to have the internet in our room, when it was free in most hotels we went to in Spain. Excellent location. 3 minutes to metro station and the best shopping streets of Madrid. If you book tickets on the internet for the bullfight on Sunday evening, the tickets office is right next door to the hotel. The restaurant is very expensive and the breakfast is overpriced. We went to a cafe not far from the Swarovski shop . It was a lot cheaper and the coffee was great. We would go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent royal service”
Reviews.Author: Jenta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights and at the hotel we asked for how much it would be to be upgraded to the rooms with jacuzzis. They charged us an extra 105 euros, but then we had our own balcony, own jacuzzi and we could also enjoy free drinks and hors d'euvres in the bar. During the summer season they don't have an own bar for those who stay in rooms with royal service, but the bar on the ground floor was an excellent option as well. The service throughout the hotel was immaculate. The rooms were very clean, they provided us with a bottle of water and fresh fruit or nuts or candy every day. The reception staff came up with some very good recommendations to both sightseeing and eating out. Breakfast was excellent and you could choose from a continental breakfast, but they also provides Madrillean spesialities and a menu wherefrom you could order omelettes, pancakes etc. The location is good if you want to be close to the museums, the fancy shopping streets (where they sell the designer stuff) and some hidden gems of small very nice boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, helpful, good location but small dark room”
Reviews.Author: Lizlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June, 2009 booked via a Travelzoo special offer. Good value, comfortable and very clean. Very friendly and helpful staff (found out Wimbledon results for me!) but the English of some of the people on the front desk was not as good as one might expect from a hotel of this rating, not that I expect everyone to speak English everywhere. Well located, walking distance from Prado, Reina Sofia, Retiro etc, 2 minutes to metro which runs til 1.30 and which took us home most nights. Felt perfectly safe travelling on it this late.Only downfall, the rooms on thisoffer were interior rooms with a view of hideous concrete walls, a fire escape and a pile of fag ends. I hadn't expected such a dark, rather claustrophobic and also small room. Worst thing was the darkness of the room, we were on the first floor so virtually no natural light felt like we were at the bottom of a tunnel. To be fair they did offer a free upgrade but didn't have an outside room with twin beds, they offered a choice of 2 rooms and really did try to help. The breakfast was wonderful, everything you could want and lots you didn't realise you wanted, Also not rushed away at the end, they asked each table if they were finished. We didn't find many decent restaurants nearby but metro & taxis are cheap & easy. This place was walking distance, friendly with a great atmosphere at lunchtime http://www.madaboutmadrid.com/photos/april_2005/taberna_la_dolores_1.html . If you go here take some advice from the hotel about which rooms/floors are best to stay on. Enjoyed our stay, 3rd time in Madrid, if first visit would prob prefer somewhere a bit more central with more atmosphere around.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: sfollett
Reviews.Content: i was booked to stay at sol melia's other hotel in Madrid, and for some reason they were overbooked. so, i was transferred to this hotel at the same rate (they were running a $100/night special at the other gran melia). This is definitely a 5-star hotel. the rooms are beautiful! the staff is excellent (in fact my luggage was lost and they gave me everything i needed to make my stay comfortable despite the hassles i went through). the location is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Drad1109
Reviews.Content: We recently had a two-night stay at the Gran Melia Fenix having arranged accommodations through a deal on TripAdvisor. As we only had a short time in Madrid, we wanted a well-located, upscale hotel. Further, as we were traveling with our two sons (ages 19 and 22) and needed two rooms, we didn't want to spend a king's ransom. In all these regards, the Gran Melia satisfied our needs. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but very nicely appointed. My younger son was particularly impressed with his room and took a photo for posterity. Our king room had a small entry foyer with a french door to the bathroom on the left and a french door to the bedroom on the right. The rooms were well equipped with air conditioning, flat panel TV, lighting and many other functions controlled by a touch-screen on the bedside table. There was was also turndown service and highly efficient housekeeping - they magically appeared and were gone if you ever left your room. The main drawback to our room was the bathroom which had a smallish main area with sink and tub/shower separated from a smaller room with a bidet and toilet. These were separated by a frosted glass door (a nice touch) but the geometry of the rooms made it quite difficult to get to the toilet and close the door. The space planner or architect responsible for this either believed in form over function or was a slender contortionist capable of executing the necessary moves. We ate at restaurants outside the hotel (including Botin's in the Plaza Mayor) so I can't comment on food service. Like most similar hotels, breakfast was shockingly expensive and we preferred a small place just next to the hotel frequented by locals. We enjoyed the stay and, given the rate paid (€128 and 176 for the twin and king rooms, respectively) felt it was good value for this quality of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some excellent deals available”
Reviews.Author: LondonGent
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gran Melia Fenix for three nights in early June and would wholeheartedly recommend it. We found a great deal on Hotel.Com about a week before our stay. This was a fraction of the rack rate but we were still given a very nice room on the outside of the building, on the third floor The windows were quadruple gazed so even though the hotel is located next to a very busy road, noise wasn't a problem. There were also blackout curtains so there was no problem with light entering the room from outside if you tend to wake at dawn like I do! The room was a good size with two windows looking out onto the street, quiet and reliable air conditioning, a good size marble bathroom with bathrobes and all the toiletries you could possibly need. Staff were also very friendly and efficient. Location is on the edge of Madrid's centre but within walking distance of most attractions. It's roughly 20 minutes walk from the Prado, 15 minutes from Chueca with its lively nightlife, and five minutes from the nearest Metro. My only caveat about this hotel is that, as expected of a five star, it was incredibly expensive to eat or drink anything. For example, a packet of crisps was 5 Euro - close to a 1000% mark up. Not really a problem as there are plenty of good restaurants within a 15-20 minute walk, just don't be tempted by the mini-bar!! Finally I would recommend obtaining a MAS loyalty card from Solmelia's web site before you stay. This allows you to check out as late as 4pm on your day of departure and you can have two for one on breakfast - if this isn't included your rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: melsriver
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel in madrid for three days. We booked it through expedia for a phenomenal deal!!! We arrived very early on a flight from London to madrid. We took the metro from the airport, only had to transfer once and I think it took a total of just over 1/2 hour. Very easy! We were at the hotel by 10:30am and they had our three rooms available immediately. They asked if we wanted the best or the quietest rooms upon check in. We went with the quieter rooms. They were on the interior of the building, so no view, but the rooms themselves were great! The bathrooms are all marble. The rooms were very quiet and they were so dark at night, you never knew what time it was! We got turndown service every night, with slippers laid out at the foot of the bed. We had a drink in the hotel bar one night on the outside patio. It is a great patio but the drinks were quite pricey. We never took a taxi once becuase the metro was so convenient to the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel either becuase there are so many other choices! The service from the front desk to the maids was exceptional. Everyone was very friendly and polite! Only down side is there is construction going on around the hotel. We didn't hear it from inside so the noise is not a worry, but walking around near the hotel was made a little difficult. When we go back to madrid we will definitely stay there. Madrid is a beautiful place and we had such a good time! Gran Melia did not dissapoint!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice”
Reviews.Author: Alaboys
Reviews.Content: Clean, stylish, classic, quiet, one block from metro. Nice staff, Two doors between bed and hallway. Never heard noise in hallway. Was surprised with charge for internet (ethernet). You get 12 free hours wireless. Thought this was below standard in Madrid. Otherwise, great hotel. Going back to Madrid, planning on staying there again, despite internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Almost entirely faultless - especially at special price”
Reviews.Author: roll-on-next-trip
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Spain before, and in fact apart from trips to London, which were more for business than pleasure, have never really 'done' a city break. This was a spontaneous booking to break up the spring, and as a lucky, extra holiday, budget was an issue - especially with the sad demise of Stirling against the Euro. So we were thrilled to find a fantastic deal at the hotel through Travelzoo, including an upgrade to a Premium room with associated gifts etc. And what gifts - not only fruit and water in the room but lovely chocolates on arrival, as well as the nightly turn-down service - chocolates on the pillow most nights and an Easter egg on Good Friday! My only single complaint of any sort was the size of the room. We were on the Plaza Colón side of the building overlooking the fountains, and I imagine in the smallest of the Premium rooms. Which is fair enough considering that the price we paid which was less than 50% of the published Easter rate. However, the room had all the style and advantages described by previous reviewers, and we found it easy to enjoy the 5* luxury and service, the fantastic breakfasts included in our package and the superb location while still keeping costs controlled. Madrid is a fairly expensive city, but worth every Euro. If you were able to splash the cash I'm sure the hotel's room service and mini bar were great, but at over €20 for a G'n'T we hit the streets for our own entertainment. It's about 20 minutes from the hotel to the centre of everything around Sol and Plaza Major with all the cervezerias, wine and tapas bars, but the streets are really interesting to wander and if you get the sort of blisters we did from pacing miles of pavements there's a great bus service outside the hotel and choice of two metro stops. Our only regrets over the trip were that we took the wrong clothes. Over 2 days it ranged from a high of 24 degrees one afternoon down to 13 degrees the next and we had taken more smart clothes than comfortable sightseeing ones - while people in the hotel make an effort for breakfast, Madrid is more about style than bling and more or less anything goes sartorially. If you're not using the hotel restaurant but are aiming for beer and tapas, you certainly don't need to overdo the collar and tie. We also took the wrong footware (those pavements are hard!), an out-of-date guidebook - use Maribel and the Tripadvisor guide as others have advised - and didn't have a Spanish phrase book. We didn't find many people who spoke English, which is fine - why should they? - but with our very rudimentary Spanish we missed out on some things such as some food items, and having a chat with locals rather than doing the English thing of pointing and talking louder! But we did have a wonderful time and are hoping to go back very soon, with the right shoes and a better phrase book. And Easter is a great time to visit. Finally, as well as the old town the hotel is walkable to the Prado (we didn't), the Reina Sofia (we did - but found you could see everything in the same sort of time it took to queue to get in - the Spanish seem good at that), the open space of Retiro Gardens and Atocha Station. Go to the station for the experience alone, even if you're not going to take a train. It's incredible - Kew Gardens with terrapins. We did take a train to lovely if touristy Toledo, but be warned that you need to book in advance - they only take bookings for seats and when the train's 'complet' it really is. You might get a ticket if you hang around for a cancellation, tickets come and go by the second. We got two tickets sitting in different carriages just after we gave up all hope, so you can be lucky. In summary, a great hotel, if classic in style rather than contemporary, and a little mean on space in some rooms. Wonderful beds, wonderful service, wonderful breakfasts and wonderful location. Wish I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: As we had stayed there in a previous trip to Madrid and were very pleased, we decided to stay there again. The Gran Melia Fenix is a chic yet understated hotel with beautifully decorated rooms, polite and helpful registration desk and concierges. Our room was a standard one, so it was small but nevertheless comfy with lots of space to keep clothes. The bathroom too was compact but covered in marble, with soft fluffy towels and first class amenities. It is surely a 5 star hotel in an European capital city!! If we come back to Madrid again, we will certainly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Madrid, old-fashioned but elegant 4.5 star rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Overall, excellent choice in Madrid. Not that many contenders in the Centro/Salamanca area (the Ritz and Westin Palace come to mind... latter full of tour groups but nice). Liked the fact it's a Spanish chain... fewer Americans as a result. Rooms: More old school elegance than state of the art... some of the furniture looks better in the photos. Our moldings were chipped and needed to be caulked. Great soundproofing from the street... but you can hear people in the halls, next door and above and below you (creaky floors). Older TV in big armoire that took up too much space. Tiny bathroom but has 2 sinks and lots of beautiful marble. Bed a little hard but okay (hard beds seem to be the Spanish way). Small windows but we had a great view of the Plaza Colon. Avoid north and east views... they look directly into office buildings. The courtyard rooms have views that seem really claustrophobic. Public Areas: Again, small but marble-clad. Elegant, mostly very well-heeled crowd. A few tour groups. Overall, well done... like a mini NYC St. Regis before they remodeled. Nice paneled piano bar, WAY too brightly lit at night. Business Center has the slowest computers in history. Wildly frustrating. Teeny-tiny gym, not really a gym at all. Staff: Very friendly and accommodating. They were great. In fact, loved all the Spanish people we encountered in Madrid. Location: The reason to stay here. You can walk or take short (cheap) cab rides virtually anywhere. Tips: Great cerveceria/tapas bar with a high-end crowd every night a few blocks away. Called "Lateral." On Velasquez in Salamanca. Apparently part of a small chain. Great bar food, incredibly cheap. Staff a little diffident but you can work them. Went there for dinner every night. 2 people, left tipsy and full, about 27 euros total. The Parc Retiro is amazing... most beautiful park in any major European city. And quiet! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice room in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some rooms that are bigger than others, if you request the Deluxe accommodations, King size bed , you will be very comfortable. The location is excellent ,near the high end Serrano shops and restaurants. Near museums and steps to the Paseo La Castellana. Do not order a Coca- Cola at the lobby bar, it will set you back ten dolares, right acrros the street is a nice coffee shop. Front desk and doormen are very courteous and helpful with directions . Airport is about 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottie001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the best location in Madrid, being in the stylish section, near calle Serrano. I was going to book at the Westin Palace, but I recalled from last year, there were no good restaurants in the area, and the metro was not convenient to my business. The Melia Fenix enjoys a great location, near the Colon monument, and it is just around the corner from the Serrano metro stop. It was an easy walk from the Prado. Check-in and check-out were easy, and the staff was uniformly helpful and friendly, as well as efficient. They offered all kinds of help with a smile, including directions, dinner suggestions, etc. The room was a bit on the small side, but was perfectly adequate and luxurious, with extremely comfortable beds, a flat-screen TV and CD player. The room was quiet and the bathroom was similarly luxurious, with ETRO toiletries. Breakfast, which was included in my rate, was excellent, with a wide variety of dishes, all delicious and fresh. I am usually a very picky person, but could find no fault with this hotel. Having stayed at several in Madrid, I can say this was the best (good value also - I booked through Otel). I will probably stay at Melia Fenix from now on, as I travel to Madrid once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jumbonav
Reviews.Content: Traveled with several other travelers here for business. I would pretty much like to echo everything everyone else says but have one addition... This room, like others in Spain does not have a complete shower door. Not sure why it bothers me so but I'm in a very nice hotel in Sevilla right now and...same thing. Its like they forgot 25% of the shower door. Oh well, maid mops up the floor, not that big a deal. Excellent room. Best included breakfast buffet I've ever had at a hotel and I travel a lot, over 100 days a year average... Ask for a room overlooking the plaza. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great group trip”
Reviews.Author: MrDemandingLondon
Reviews.Content: We were a group of about 25 Brits on a work trip, and this hotel looked after us extremely well. The hotel was as you would expect from the other reviews: clean and smart after a refurbishment; in a good location near the centre of things; good sized rooms; decent food. However we were most impressed by the friendly nature of the staff which ultimately makes the difference. For context a couple of us went for tea at the Ritz and they refused to let us take our pile of unfinished cakes away in a doggy bag - not the sort of service you want when paying through the nose, and places the Gran Melia in positive contrast. My only caution is that all the meeting rooms are underground and have no windows, which isn't ideal. That said, the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E_Panama
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the luxury of the hotel, the size of the rooms, and the friendliness of the staff. Our room was huge with a sitting area and huge bathroom. Everything was top of the line and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was more than eager to help, and very friendly. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and very tasty, and there's a Hard Rock Cafe next door which was also very handy. Location is ok, you need to get a cab to get to the Gran Via, or a 30 minute walk. Highly recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Madrid experience”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix for 4 days in November. I have stayed in several places in Madrid- Westin Palace, Hotel Hesperia, Melia Los Galgos- the Gran Melia Fenix rivals all. The location simply cannot be beaten- you have access to everything without the claustrophobic feeling you get staying in the area around the Ritz/ Palace (Plaza de Canovas). The GM is totally renovated, beautiful lobby and our room was enormous with a huge bathroom- a major luxury in Europe. Had incredible help from staff when we did need it, some of the best time we spent was wandering through the Salamanca neighborhood and going for tapas in the Santa Ana area. If you get a craving for American food the Hard Rock is right around the corner (be aware that on Sunday that may be your only option as almost everything is closed). The Colon metro stop is right there for longer excursions but you literally can get almost anywhere on foot from the GM. Be sure and ask for a room that faces the Plaza Colon.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: roame_da_earth
Reviews.Content: Everything I would expect from a 5* hotel. I have to admit, this is the first 5* hotel I have stayed in but I was not disappointed. The lobby is a bit small, but very beautiful with a grand staircase. Also on the same floor there is a beautiful little lounge and bar room with a very cozy feel. There is even a doorman to meet you upon your every arrival and departure. The location is very good being in the center of the old part of Madrid with fountains and statues right outside the hotel. Also, there is a Hard Rock Cafe right below the hotel if you aren't interested in the Spanish cousine. When entering the room I found chocolates to greet me with a beautiful plush bed with a very rich cozy decor. All the lights and airconditioning could be controlled by a little black box that sits on the night stand next to your bed. There is a maid service in the morining and a turn down service in the evening, where they again give you little chocolates. There are plenty of channels on the tv to choose from, including a few English speaking channels, a German channel and another channel in which I believe they spoke Japanese. The bathroom is done up in all marble with all the toiletries that you will need, so no need to bring your own. I also, really loved that there were speakers in the bathroom that were connected to the televison so I was able to listen to the tv while I showered. I've never done that before and found that to be a really neat touch. The rooms are spotless and the staff was very nice. Every moning when I was leaving my room, the maids always greeted me and even when I tried to speak Spanish, they were nice enough to speak to me in English. That was really nice. The breakfast is nice, but for a 5* hotel, the selection was not as large as I expected but there was still enough choices to find something you will like. This is a great hotel and I will definetely stay here again when I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Gran Melia Fenix in June 2008 in a king non-smoking corner room. Room was good size, very clean, with large bathroom complete with plenty of toiletries, hair dryer, robe, slippers, etc. Bed was a litte hard. Armoire had safe and mini-bar. Internet access in room is 8EUR. Staff was all helpful and kind; concierge offered good recommendations on restaurants and site-seeing. Hotel is centrally located in Serrano shopping area and just short walk (10 min) to many museums and sites. Taxis were easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSCPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Madrid tend to be quite expensive and the Grand Fenix is no exception . The Location is ok its about 15 minutes walk from the main tourist attractions . There are two types of rooms the ones that face inwards with no view which are a bit small however the bed was comfy . My colleague asked for a better room and paid 35 Euro more and got a room with an outside balcony and a view . A couple of things you have to know is that the restaurant does not open until 9pm and breakfast starts at 7am till 11 which is not untypical of Madrid . The staff were very helpful and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “You can almost smell the new paint.”
Reviews.Author: Opebble
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in a Royal Service Room with access to private lounge. King size bed - one bed not two singles. Tiny bathroom but as I was on my own not a problem. Double glazing fantastic - room was on Catellana - main drag through Madrid and I couldn't hear a thing! Remote controls for lights, A/C etc very confusing - must be my advancing years! All staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel refurbished last August or so and corridors are absolutely spotless as was the room. Private lounge v good - free bar and nibblies. Staff recognised me by my name throughout. Main restaurant very good and again staff very friendly. Taxi rank right outside Hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: CRHeel94
Reviews.Content: The property is conveniently located in the Serrano district with easy access to many shops and restaurants. Taxi cabs in Madrid are pretty cheap so you have easy access to a gran Via/Puerta de Sol as well as the museums. The staff was generally helpful with requests and recommendations. The breakfast buffet is decent, but if you want something that's not there they will accomodate some requests without a problem (e.g., sunny side up eggs). The free wifi in the lobby is a nice touch and convenient for checking messages quickly. The rooms are very small, including a tiny bathroom. The king bed is two twin beds pushed together. The TV has a pretty wide selection of channels (rather rare in Europe) which was nice for winding down at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Memories of Gran Fenix”
Reviews.Author: TimK-M
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Gran Fenix Madrid following a 4 night stay in Prague at around 10pm (following flight delays). Group of 4. Husband and Wife. Son and Grand Mother. Note for Spain twin rooms - the beds are seperate but always together and will need to be pulled apart to suit 2 people sharing. Booked Gran Fenix on a special low season deal that included breakfast. My initial reaction was slightly dissappointing. Looking back, however, it was quite a good hotel. Location proved to be excellent (wouldn't stay in the old part of Madrid). The Colon plaza down to Retiro are excellent locations and out of the "ugly" side of Madrid. Gran Fenix is near the best shopping and close to a Supermarket. Easy access to sights (train, cab, bus and open bus tours stop near building). Gran Fenix rooms are well appointed and hark back to a Grand style. Carpets could be replaced and there are some tattered edges which have been referred to by other reviewers. Bathrooms have some irritating clutter and the usual outdated bidet. Direct in-room cable internet was the fastest we experienced in Europe. Gran Fenix buffet breakfast was 100% the biggest and best served up in all 6 European tours thus far - but lost on a 1 bowl of cereal and 1 pot of coffee person. Bar and Lounges are this Hotels biggest plus. Hotel staff were good quality hospitality personnel. Restaurant is fine dining but not really an "experience". If travelling with family try the Pizza Garden (other meals served) around the corner. Clean, fast and quality food at good price. Hard Rock cafe below hotel (part of building). Hyatt is being gutted and re-fitted up the road. Will probably set a 5 star benchmark and be ready after mid-2008. Check it out, otherwise, Gran Fenix is good for a comfortable stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: smstl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago on a business trip. Hotel lobby is very nice with a comfortable sitting area. Front desk staff was excellent and very helpful. Did not use the restaurant as there are many places within easy walking distance. Hard Rock Cafe is in the same building on the other side, so that was good. Great location for the museums and walking tours of the city as well. The bedrooms were a mixed bag.The sleeping area was very nice, but a bit small. Bed was very comfortable, good desk for working with high speed internet access. The room was also decorated very nicely. TV and stereo were nicer than I have in my own home. The bathroom on the other hand was very dated. It did have a lot of marble area, but the tub/shower was very old with the large bathroom window on the main wall with a pull down shade that almost covered the window. Overall, I will probably stay here again on my next visit. It's clean, comfortable, a very friendly staff, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenan2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip to Madrid. This is a very nice hotel with an excellent location in the center of Madrid. The staff are very professional and very friendly. The rooms are really nice with modern TV and stereo system. I stayed at room 306 and room 406 and they were great with beautiful marble bathrooms and Etro soap, shampoo and lotion. However, some rooms have small bathrooms so I think it's better to ask for a corner room. The breakfast is great and so delicious... It's the best breakfast I have ever tried in hotels. Hard Rock cafe is adjacent to this hotel. It's a short drive from the airport ( about 15 minutes by taxi ). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster Leading Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scherz0
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a member of the Sol and Leading Hotels of the World and we were expecting exemplary service, excellent rooms and a high quality restaurant. The two areas where we were unhappy were the room allocation and, in particular, the restaurant service. The public rooms, porter service, concierge and security were all exemplary with courteous staff and a good standard of decor and cleanliness (with the usual exception of the TV remote control). The room we had booked and had confirmed was described as non-smoking, deluxe interior with queen bed and patio view. While the room's standard of decor and cleanliness was good, it was rather cramped, overlooked a metal curved hood of some sort and, we discovered later, was noisy. The noise being generated from both the in-room air conditioning and mechanical or electrical noise from outside and below. Because this was a one night stay en-route to the airport, we did not bother requesting a room change at the time. Had I realised that the room was going to be so noisy, I would certainly have done so. Our primary area of complaint was, however, the restaurant. When we arrived we were 2 of the 3 customers present. The chair was not pulled out for the lady and the table not fully laid. The starters were well prepared and the wine good although improperly uncorked. Due to a mix-up in the kitchen, the first main course was not cooked as ordered and the second delivered cold. Although we had to attract the waiter's attention and were not asked whether everything was satisfactory, the problem was resolved. One of the dessert courses was again incorrect and I felt that 9e for the other dessert which was, to all intents and purposes, diced jelly and ice with a sauce was excessively expensive. Although present, the head waiter spent much of his time talking very audibly on a mobile phone or pager and at no point asked whether we were satisfied with any of the dishes. Nor did he apologise for the errors. The other waiter present may have been in training, but was polite and did his best to sort out the problems. Having stayed in a number of the 'Leading Hotels of the World' we were expecting a similar level of service and facilities. While many areas lived up to our expectations, we were very disappointed with the quality and service in the restaurant and not entirely happy with the room itself. On the plus side, the Madrid Hard Rock Cafe is adjacent to the hotel, and a hell of a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Mont1e
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in central Madrid. Breakfast and staff were excellent. Communal areas are very grand and plush. However, our room was quite small, and we could not afford to buy a drink in the hotel - 6.50 Euros for a small can of Coke!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best hotels in Madrid. The location is excellent, right on the Plaza de Colon, with great views. I have stayed in it several times and it has always met and exceeded my expectations. It's within walking distance to all the major museums, shopping areas and the Metro is right next to it. Has satellite TV with all the major US networks and international channels also like RAI, TVE, french, russian, japanese and Al-Jazeera. The rooms are nicely appointed, quiet and the views are without par.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Spanish style service.”
Reviews.Author: DJTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times. It's a great hotel- clean, spacious rooms and beautiful public areas. The location isnext to the best shopping in town, although it is quite difficult to find cabs during busy times of day as the front door of the hotel is not located on a major street. Very good breakfast. Service is okay- but I think this is more a reflection of the general culture than a trait unique to the hotel. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Sloppy Service”
Reviews.Author: Sergioo
Reviews.Content: I got a nice room through the SolMelia website. It wasn't small although the toilet area was definitively not suitable for someone a bit overweight (fortunately not my case!) Breakfast was excellent, specially the "jamon de bellota". The shopping area around the hotel is amongst the best in Madrid. The only issues I experienced were related to front desk’s service: it was sloppy to say the least. One day I was expecting an urgent fax (I was on a short business trip, did not bring my laptop, and the business center only got two computers), and they lost it. The next morning (due to the time difference between Spain and South America) I inquired about my fax at the front desk (I got confirmation from my office that it was sent out), and they undoubtedly affirmed that no fax was received for me. So that same morning my fax was resent to me, my secretary call me right after to say it did go through, but I needed to wait over 30 minutes to get it at my door, despite all the incidents around that fax... So I asked again about my lost fax at the front desk, and they now accepted they may have lost it. The funny thing is that the fax machine is right adjacent to the front desk! In addition, none, yes, none, of the messages that were left to me at the front desk were ever delivered to me. These issues are unacceptable for a business hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: pottypete
Reviews.Content: i stayed for one night and i would stay here again, my room was just above the hard rock cafe but i could only hear street noise now and then. i had a king size bed and the room was fine, i ordered breakfast in bed which arrived in ten minutes, they brought me everything from yogurts to egg and bacon although the eggs had gone cold on the way up this was a small price to pay for a good stay. the only thing that concerned me was the bathroom had a clear glass door and if you were with children you would have to turn the light out when you used the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “It is a recurrent theme, rooms are cramped. Not sure about the Mars bars either.”
Reviews.Author: FebMara
Reviews.Content: The lobby's glass cupola is beautiful and the lobby is easily the best place to spend time in the hotel. Our room (number 310) was nicely decorated but cramped and the view from the only window was a wall. I would not have wanted to spend too much time in that room, luckily there was plenty to do outside and the sun was shining. Did I feel that this was a “Leading Hotel” experience? No. However, service was very attentive and charming, and breakfast was good. I think the amenities in the rooms could be improved to make the experience less claustrophobic, by having for example coffee/tea making facilities, wireless internet, and some fruit. Also, some real chocolate rather than the Mars Delight left on the pillows at night would have been more appropriate to the "Leading Hotel" label. Location is good but not exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March 2006. An easy drive from the airport - took about half an hour. We loved th hotel and would definitely stay here again. The hotel is next to Plaza Colon in a good district handy for shops and restaurants. You're right next to the metro and a couple of bus stops so great for sight seeing. It was also an easy walk to the Retiro park. Our room (704) was on the top floor - one of the 'club' rooms. These rooms have a separate reception/concierge on that floor as well as a large lounge area where you have breakfast. Breakfast choices were great - cereals, breads, pastries, cheeses, meats, fruits, champagne, fruit juices, coffee, tea - hard not to find something you liked. After breakfast (from 7am - 11am) they always had cheeses, fruits, pastries, a variety of tapas, breads etc available throughout the day up until 11pm - as well as a very well stocked help yourself bar - no-one minded if you wandered in, poured yourself a couple of drinks, helped yourself to a plate of tapas and took it back to enjoy in your room. This was great after a day's sightseeing and then to finish off your evening with a nightcap under the stars on your balcony. Ah yes, our room - nice spacious lobby area, large bathroom but with tiny bath with shower over. Decorated in black & gold - not to my taste exactly. Bedroom was small but huge king size bed took up most of floor space but nicely decorated in formal English house style. Quite sombre and dark - very firm bed. Room was quiet so no traffic noise. Nice surprise was large balcony with table and chairs for four and steps up to a huge hot tub jacuzzi which was brilliant - very hot and very bubbly. Just be careful on a weekday since (room 704 anyway!) faces towards the 'back' of the hotel and you overlook adjoining office blocks and although your hot tub is well screened, when standing up to clamber out you might attract some interest! When you're sitting out on the balcony though you are totally secluded and private. We were very well looked after by all the hotel staff who were unfailingly professional, polite, friendly and helpful. Special mention must go to our reception/concierge Patricia who recommended great restaurants for us. She saw our look of despair when at first she recommended a flamenco restaurant - we're really not keen on the well-trodden tourist places and she came up with some other ideas for us. On our first night we ate in El General - a down to earth tapas bar restaurant full of loud noisy Spanish families - the food was excellent, no-one could speak a word of English and we loved it - just getting by on sign language and lots of laughter (and lots of vino!) Another restaurant we tried for Sunday lunch was Asador de Aranda - this is actually a very popular Spanish chain of restaurants and there are serveral in Madrid - don't let this put you off. They only serve Castillan white fleshed lamb - cooked in a vast oven with herbs on oak charcoal embers - atmosphere totally Spanish (again we were only foreigners in there and again no-one could speak English) and the lamb was amazing - pick it up and eat with your fingers for maximum enjoyment. Final evening for something totally different we ate at a Thai restaurant just around the corner from hotel. We love Thai food and this was very good. Everyone spoke English, it was full of English and Americans so very different but very pretty restaurant and service was excellent. Madrid is a beautiful, compact city - very easy to travel around and Gran Melia Fenix ticks all the boxes for a long weekend or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, Ameneties closed”
Reviews.Author: ACPACPACP
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on top floor, which said it features Club-Amenities. But as we expirienced, the Club was closed as there were nearly no guests in the hotel. So we had to go for standard breakfast, which was fantastic quality & choice anyway. Be sure to go for bigger rooms than standard, they were incredible small! The complete hotel was very nicely decorated, even our room. But as I said: very, very small! Staff is very friendly, but chaotic. They wanted to charge us breakfast, because they didn't see that it was included with the room. Spa was also not available, beacause it was simply closed (just as the club).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Larry J
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice in the near center of Madrid. Rooms were well appointed, bathrooms small. Buffet breakfast at the hotel was outstanding as was a dinner taken at the hotel one evening. Very convenient for all that Madrid has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaMcD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia Fenix from Nov. 21 - 28, 2005. Our room included a king-size bed (which translates in most European hotels, including the GMF, to two twin-sized beds pushed together), mini-bar, internet service, and marble bath. Our room was quite spacious by European standards and very well-appointed. Rooms at the Gran Melia Fenix are certainly comparable to rooms at any Four Seasons Hotel location in the US, for example. We stayed on the Royal Service Floor which meant, among other things, that we could avail ourselves of a private breakfast buffet each morning. It was quite delicious and offered a wide selection of both Spanish food and traditional breakfast fare. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is central. Our only criticism concerned the comfort of the mattress in our room. It was too firm. However, we would not hesitate to stay here again.
